sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: This is a sample set before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Flare Blitz is a strong STAB move and enables Arcanine to defeat foes like Gholdengo, Corviknight, Meowscarada, and Breloom.
  • Close Combat is a good coverage move that allows Arcanine to handle Roaring Moon and Tyranitar.
  • Play Rough is an excellent option to deal with Goodra and Sableye.
  • Outrage can be used to handle Choice item Dragapult and Goodra.
  • Extreme Speed allows Arcanine to win some close matchups, like non-bulky Haxorus, and can be important against Iron Valiant and Espathra.
  • The HP EVs allow Arcanine to survive Earthquake from Adamant Choice Band Baxcalibur and Power Gem from Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs outspeed Bold Corviknight, and the remaining EVs are put in Attack for maximum damage output.
  • An alternative EV spread of 116 HP / 144 Atk / 216 Def / 32 Spe can be run, allowing Arcanine to survive Giga Impact from Adamant Choice Band Slaking and Power Gem from Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane.
  • Magnezone is the one foe with Sturdy that Arcanine should be careful with, yet it can manage to win against Choice Specs Magnezone if Arcanine starts with Extreme Speed instead of Close Combat or Flare Blitz.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Tera Fairy helps improve Slowbro's matchup against threats like Slither Wing, Tyranitar, and Mimikyu.

sets.name: Super Smash Sweeper
sets.description:
• Shell Smash and Skill Link more than make up for Cloyster's weak Attack stat, making it a formidable sweeper that Focus Sash and Mimikyu can't easily stop.

  • Ice Shard: Priority may seem like overkill, but it helps for not only picking off weakened threats, but getting around priority attacks from Breloom, Dragapult, and Meowscarada.

  • Rock Blast: This is Closyer's best shot at dealing with the many Tera Fires that will attempt to deal with Icicle Spear, as well as OHKOing Volcarona, Iron Bundle, and Iron Moth.

  • Drill Run: This hits Gholdengo and other Steel-types hard without needing to Terastallize.

Tera Types

  • Ice: The increased damage from Tera Ice makes it very difficult for Pokemon to wall Cloyster without resisting it, with even Corviknight getting OHKOed by +2 Adamant Icicle Spear after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Fire: While boosted Tera Blast actually does less damage to Corviknight than Tera Ice Icicle Spear, Tera Fire otherwise helps Cloyster muscle past Steel-types it traditionally struggles to beat, such as Scizor.

  • Grass: Tera Grass gives Cloyster coverage against troublesome Water-tyes such as Rotom-W, in addition to a handy Spore immunity.

  • Electric: Tera Electric gives Cloyster coverage for Corviknight, Toxapex, and Water-types with one moveslot.

  • Ghost: Since Cloyster will often be at extremely low health after Shell Smash, Tera Ghost helps it avoid getting revenge killed by Breloom's Mach Punch. It also provides coverage against Gholdengo with Tera Blast.

  • Normal: Tera Normal offers no offensive benefits to Cloyster, but it does prevent Mimikyu from revenge killing it with Shadow Sneak.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Considering Cloyster's paper thin Special Defense, Focus Sash gives Cloyster by far the most set up opportunities.

  • King's Rock: King's Rock is a risky option for making Cloyster difficult to set up, but it does give Icicle Spear a 41% chance of flinching.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description: Tera Ghost is used to power up Shadow Ball, giving Gengar a decent chance to OHKO Quagsire and Talonflame and 2HKO specially defensive Gastrodon. Tera Fairy is an alternative that lets Gengar resist moves such as Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Lokix.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Ghost makes up for Choice Scarf Gengar's lack of power, ensuring that it can 2HKO Quagsire. Tera Fairy lets Gengar resist Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Lokix.

sets.name: Substitute + 3 Attacks
sets.description: Tera Ghost ensures that Gengar can 2HKO Quagsire. Tera Fairy lets it resist Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Lokix. Leftovers should always be run instead of Black Sludge to prevent self-damage when Terastillizing.

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description: Tera Ghost powers up Gengar's Shadow Ball, possibly OHKOing Gastrodon at +2 and maximizing its damage versus Unaware Quagsire, all while removing its Ground weakness. Tera Fairy prevents Sucker Punch users such as Bisharp and Lokix from revenge killing it.

sets.name: Hex
sets.description: Tera Ghost powers up Gengar's Hex, 2HKOing a burned Gastrodon and removing its Ground weakness, letting it potentially beat it one-on-one. Tera Fairy allows Gengar to resist Sucker Punch from Bisharp and Lokix. Leftovers should always be run instead of Black Sludge to prevent self-damage when Terastillizing.

sets.name: Disruptor
sets.description:
• Gengar's useful immunities and fast Encore give it a niche as an incredibly disruptive Pokemon, especially if taking the correct predictive risks.

  • Destiny Bond: Destiny Bond is excellent at making foes second guess attacking Gengar. When slower foes don't take the bait and use a setup move, Gengar can punish them with Encore.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave is great at crippling faster sweepers if Gengar's Focus Sash is intact, and punishing fast, common switch-ins such as Roaring Moon.

  • Sludge Bomb: This covers Meowscarada and Fairy-types, in addition to being Gengar's most powerful attack.

  • Dazzling Gleam In addition to OHKOing Hydreigon after Stealth Rock damage, Dazzling Gleam is an appealing secondary STAB move when using Tera Fairy.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast is Gengar's best shot at beating Kingambit outside of Destiny Bond.

Other Options

  • Will-O-Wisp Gengar does a great job of burning bulky sweepers that Gengar can be forced to Destiny Bond against, such as Dragonite, Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Tera Annihilape.

Tera Types

  • Normal: Tera Normal Gengar can turn slower Ghost-types such as Mimikyu, Flutter Mane, and Annihilape into easy Encore targets.

  • Fairy: A Dragon-type immunity gives Gengar new Encore targets and better threatens Dragon-types.

  • Flying: Earthquake is a common attack against Gengar, so Tera Flying can turn the tables effectively. It also takes advantage of common Fissure users such as Dondozo and Garganacl.

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type lets Gengar surprise Espathra, letting it Encore Stored Power and potentially ruin its sweep.

sets.name: Pink Blob
sets.description: This is a sample set before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Imposter
sets.description: With Imposter, Chansey transforms into a far bulkier version of the opposing Pokemon, which can be further bolstered by Eviolite. This provides a myriad of benefits, including blanket checking most Pokemon, scouting sets, and PP stalling less threatening foes. While Eviolite is usually the best item, Covert Cloak is useful against Nuzzle and Spirit Shackle users. The given moves offer the most utility in the rare situations Chansey is not transformed, like phazing Substitute users, pivoting, and acting as a cleric. Offensive threats such as Zacian-C and Miraidon appreciate the information Imposter Chansey provides through scouting. Imposter Chansey appreciates slow pivoting from Pokemon like Dondozo and RegenVest Ting-Lu for safe scouting; these Pokemon can also provide Knock Off support, aiding against Judgment users like Miraidon that can otherwise defeat Imposter Chansey. Tera Normal gives Chansey a STAB boost on Judgment, improving its matchup into Pokemon like Miraidon, while Tera Fire and Tera Ghost are useful against Zacian-C and trapping moves, respectively.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description: Tera Fighting helps strengthen the power of Close Combat. Alternatively, Tera Electric strengthens the power of Wild Charge towards Slowking and can catch Talonflame attempting to hit Paldean Tauros-F with Brave Bird.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Fighting helps remove the Stealth Rock weakness from Paldean Tauros-F and increases the power of Close Combat.

sets.name: FIREFIGHTER (Defensive)
sets.description:
• Will-O-Wisp and Intimidate make Paldean Tauros-F a potent check to physical attackers, notably enabling it reliably check Kingambit.

  • Raging Bull: This provides a powerful STAB attack that can also break screens, allowing Paldean Tauros-F’s teammates to clean up more easily.

  • Body Press Body Press is valuable because unlike Close Combat, it doesn’t cause defense drops.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb allows Paldean Tauros-F to check Volcarona despite its meager Special Defense.

  • Paldean Tauros-F should generally avoid Terastallizing, as its typing is a big part of what lets it act as such a sturdy check to Kingambit and other massive threats, such as Baxcalibur.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers makes up for Paldean Tauros-F’s lack of manual recovery.

  • Sitrus Berry: This can be used as an alternative to Leftovers if they are otherwise unavailable.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: This allows Paldean Tauros-F to switch around more freely in after entry hazards are set.

sets.name: Offensive Screen Smasher
sets.description:
• Paldean Tauros-F is fast enough to outspeed key threats such as Hydreigon and Mimikyu, making an offensive set viable.

  • Raging Bull: Raging Bull might not be as powerful as Flare Blitz, but its ability to break Reflect and Light Screen make it an essential attack.

  • Flame Charge: This gives Paldean Tauros-F an unexpected late-game win condition, letting it outspeed threats such as Dragapult and Iron Bundle.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb's speed control is useful when sacrificing Paldean Tauros-F against a threat and prevents Dragonite from getting easy Speed boosts.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Despite this set's offensive nature, Will-O-Wisp is good for punishing Dragonite, Dragapult, and foes that may Terrastallize, such as Kingambit.

  • Bulk Up: Bulk Up is another potentially surprising win condition in the late stages of the game, and helps against Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type makes Paldean Tauros-F far less vulnerable to Rotom-W, Great Tusk, and Palafin-H.

  • Fairy: When paired with Tera Blast, a Fairy Tera type means Dragon-types will no longer wall Paldean Tauros-F.

Items

  • Eject Pack: With Close Combat, this will give Paldean Tauros-F a powerful, one-time use pivot option.

  • Assault Vest: Patching up Paldean Tauros-F's mediocre Special Defense gives it a better shot against Dragapult and Rotom-W when Terastallizing.

  • Mirror Herb: Mirror Herb punishes setup sweepers even more effectively and pairs especially well with Intimidate.

  • Life Orb: This high value item can be tough to slot in, but the increased power makes sweeping with a Speed boost much easier.

sets.name: Dragon Dance Sweeper
sets.description:
• With Dragon Dance and its solid movepool and typing, Gyarados becomes a a viable sweeper that can take on major threats such as Great Tusk and physical Iron Valiant.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake is Gyarados's best coverage option against Magnezone, Iron Hands, and Water Absorb Clodsire.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast allows Gyarados to give itself another coverage option with various Tera types or provide a reliable Flying STAB attack for it to use after Terastallization.

  • Ice Fang: Ice Fang is valuable coverage versus Grass- and Dragon-type Pokemon who may try to deal with Gyarados, such as Dragonite, Brute Bonnet, and Hydreigon.

  • Taunt: This shuts down passive Pokemon and status users such as Corviknight, Scream Tail, and Skeledirge, opening the door for more opportunities to sweep.

Abilities

  • Intimidate: Intimidate gives Gyarados more opportunities to set up on weakened physical attackers, such as Choice Band Garchomp and Choice Band Tera Dragon Dragapult.

  • Moxie: Moxie gives Gyarados sweeping potential after it picks off weakened foes like Hippowdon and Breloom, which reduces Gyarados's reliance on Dragon Dance.

Items

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry helps protect Gyarados from status and makes it easier to set up on sleep inducers such as Brute Bonnet, Breloom, and Amoonguss.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb boosts Electric Tera Blast enough to potentially 2HKO Dondozo and OHKO Iron Bundle and secures the OHKO against Dragapult with +1 Ice Fang.

Tera Types

  • Ground: In addition to gaining a immunity to Electric-type attacks and giving Gyarados a resistance to rock-type attacks that threaten it, Gound Tera also boosts the power of Earthquake.

  • Flying: While not helping it's matchup versus Pokemon that threaten it, Tera Flying gives Gyarados access to a very dangerous STAB Flying move once it is boosted.

  • Electric: Tera Electric not only covers Gyarados's Electric-type weakness, but it also vastly improves its matchup against Iron Bundle.

  • Grass: Grass Tera eliminates Gyarados's weakness to Electric type attacks such as Rotom-W's Volt Switch and gives it an immunity to Spore from the likes of Breloom and Amoonguss.

sets.name: Imposter
sets.description: These are sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Offensive Dragon Dance
sets.description:
Multiscale combined with solid natural bulk, a high Attack stat, and Dragon Dance enable Dragonite become a deadly set-up sweeper. Extreme Speed is an excellent move for any physical sweeper, due to its high power and initiative over other priority users such as Chien-Pao. Earthquake provides coverage against bulky foes such as Toxapex, Garganacl, and Clodsire. Fire Punch OHKOes Scizor and 2HKOes physically defensive Corviknight after a Dragon Dance and Stealth Rock. Alternatively, Ice Spinner hits opposing Dragonite, Great Tusk, and Dragapult super effectively, notably OHKOing Dragapult after a Dragon Dance. Heavy-Duty Boots + Roost improves Dragonite's longevity and possibly enables it to retain Multiscale and obtain multiple boosts; preserving Multiscale is particularly useful for surviving Draco Meteor from Timid Choice Specs Dragapult. However, the loss of coverage against targets such as Corviknight and Air Balloon Gholdengo is noticeable. Tera Normal turns Extreme Speed into an incredibly powerful STAB priority move capable of shredding offensive teams after a single boost, and a timely typing change also removes Dragonite's weaknesses to Ice, Fairy, and Dragon, which can buy a free turn to set up. An Adamant nature is preferred since it maximizes the power of Extreme Speed, which often makes makes Speed stats irrelevant, but a Jolly nature can also be used to outspeed the Normal-immune Dragapult after a Dragon Dance, which is especially useful if Dragonite is running Ice Spinner.

Offensive Dragon Dance Dragonite regularly serves as a potent win con on offensive teams that can also act as a revenge killer against fast and frail threats. Multiscale Dragonite's considerable bulk, as well as Ghost immunity with Tera Normal provides significant defensive utility for offensive teams. In particular, teams using frail offensive Pokemon such as Chien-Pao and Iron Valiant appreciate the defensive utility Dragonite brings. In return, these Pokemon can help wallbreak for a late-game Dragonite sweep. Entry hazard support from Great Tusk, Glimmora, or Garchomp is appreciated to weaken Pokemon such as Chien-Pao and Iron Valiant into range of boosted Extreme Speed. Dual screens support from Grimmsnarl and Shed Tail support from Orthworm are potential options that can supplement Dragonite's already great bulk and virtually guarantee the ability to acquire multiple boosts. Since Dragonite struggles against bulky Unaware users such as Dondozo and Skeledirge, a teammate that can switch into and check these Pokemon, such as Rotom-W, is appreciated. Rotom-W can cripple these physical walls with Trick, gain momentum against them with Volt Switch, and absorb Will-O-Wisp from Skeledirge.

sets.name: Bulky Dragon Dance
sets.description:
With the combination of its solid natural bulk, valuable typing, reliable recovery in Roost, and Multiscale, Dragonite can accrue multiple Dragon Dance boosts and become a dangerous bulky setup sweeper. It can set up on common Pokemon such as Great Tusk lacking Bulk Up or Ice Spinner, non-Will-O-Wisp Volcarona, and even super effective attacks from Iron Valiant and Choice Specs Dragapult thanks to Multiscale. Extreme Speed alongside Tera Normal lets Dragonite clean up late-game, OHKOing faster threats like Meowscarada and potentially Chien-Pao and Cinderace at +1. It also outprioritizes Chien-Pao's Ice Shard and Meowscarada's Sucker Punch as well as Grimmsnarl's Prankster-boosted Reflect and Thunder Wave. Earthquake covers Normal-resistant and -immune Pokemon, including foes like Dragapult, non-Air Balloon Gholdengo, Garganacl, and Kingambit. 144 HP EVs allow Dragonite to survive Tera Fairy Iron Valiant's Moonblast at +1 through Multiscale and Tera Fairy Espathra's Dazzling Gleam after minor chip damage breaking Multiscale. Aside from strengthening Dragonite's Extreme Speed, Tera Normal sheds off its weaknesses to give it setup opportunities against would-be threats like Chien-Pao, Dragapult, and Hatterene. Heavy-Duty Boots keeps Multiscale intact by ignoring Stealth Rock.

Bulky Dragon Dance Dragonite fits well on bulky offense. A defensive backbone consisting of Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Gholdengo, and Corviknight is valuable to check threats like Dragapult, Iron Valiant, and Chien-Pao, respectively, which would threaten Dragonite prior to boosting; in return, Dragonite can answer threats like Roaring Moon, Cinderace, and Volcarona for them. Garchomp, Glimmora, and Ting-Lu can reliably set entry hazards, which rack up chip damage onto walls such as Dondozo, Great Tusk, and Garganacl and puts revenge killers like Iron Valiant and Chien-Pao into guaranteed KO range of +1 Tera Normal Extreme Speed. Wallbreakers such as Breloom, Chien-Pao, and Great Tusk can punch holes early-game and overwhelm Dragonite's checks, such as Corviknight, Dondozo, Skeledirge, and defensive Great Tusk. Moreover, Breloom can incapacitate foes with Spore to give setup opportunities for Dragonite, while Great Tusk can use Knock Off to cripple Corviknight and Dondozo and pop Gholdengo's Air Balloon. Other setup sweepers are great partners; Volcarona can threaten Corviknight, use Tera Steel Rotom-W as setup fodder, and spread burns with Flame Body and Will-O-Wisp against physical attackers such as Iron Valiant, Iron Hands, and Roaring Moon to further support Dragonite.

With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Extreme Killernite
sets.description:
• With Tera Normal, Dragonite can do its best impression of Arceus, with a powerful Extreme Speed that makes Dragonite a great revenge killer and sweeper in one!

  • Earthquake versus Fire Punch: Earthquake is Dragonite's strongest tool against most Steel-types, but Fire Punch is worth considering to hit Corviknight.

  • Low Kick: This is a far more reliable move against Kingambit, and can help in Tera Normal Dragonite mirrors.

  • Outrage and Dragon Claw: While a Dragon-type STAB move is useful against opposing Dragons and is Dragonite's best shot at picking off weakened Dondozo, it's not strictly needed on this Dragonite.

  • Jolly versus Adamant: A Jolly nature allows Dragonite to outspeed Dragapult, Iron Bundle, and Flutter Mane after one use of Dragon Dance, but Adamant is a reasonable consideration if revenge killing with Extreme Speed is more important.

Items

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry gives Dragonite more set up opportunities against status moves and pairs particularly well with Outrage to cure confusion.

  • Silk Scarf: This item goes all in on Extreme Speed's revenge killing power, without conflicting with Multiscale.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb doesn't pair well with Multiscale on paper, but the power boost it gives Extreme Speed can let Dragonite clean teams up earlier.

sets.name: Defensive Dragon Dance
sets.description:
• Dragonite's good bulk gives it plenty of chances to set up Dragon Dance, while still providing a solid defensive backbone.

  • Encore: Encore makes setting up on slower defensive foes such as Corviknight fairly easy.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With Tera Blast, Tera Flying gives Dragonite a solid mono-attacking option and defensive typing in one, at the cost of always needing to Terastallize.

  • Steel: Tera Steel covers Dragonite's former weaknesses very well, and can still work somewhat well even if not Terastallized thanks to Iron Head.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet lets Dragonite play more passively thanks to the chip damage.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Preserving Multiscale even when Stealth Rock is set up can help Dragonite survive attacks in emergencies.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's passive healing gives Dragonite a better matchup against passive foes it can Encore.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 100 Def / 156 Spe with Impish: This EV Spread allows Dragonite to outspeed Jolly Kingambit before boosting, and up to Timid Scream Tail after Dragon Dance, avoiding a potentially faster Encore.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed outspeeds Jolly Dragapult, Timid Flutter Mane, and Timid Iron Bundle after a Dragon Dance, and at least speed ties with offensive Dragonite.

sets.name: Defensive Encore
sets.description:
• Due to Dragonite's offensive presence and high bulk, many opponents choose to either check it defensively or set up against it to break through Roost + Multiscale. Against either option, Encore can turn Dragonite practically invincible allowing it to reside on the field indefinitely in most cases.

  • Fire Spin: This allows Dragonite to defeat almost any Pokemon universally by simply making full use of its longevity. Trapping an Encore locked Pokemon in the field is also highly valuable. Fire Spin is used instead of Wrap because it affects Ghost-types and doesn't trigger chip damage from Rough Skin and Rocky Helmet.

  • Encore and Thunder Wave: Encore is most effective against slower foes. Thunder Wave allows Dragonite to lock a much wider variety of Pokemon into their moves, while also giving it more opportunities to keep Multiscale up via potential paralysis.

  • Substitute: Substitute adds to Dragonite's longevity. Baiting a status move such as Toxic or Yawn, blocking it with Substitute, and locking the move in with Encore guarantees Dragonite an active Substitute while defeating the opposing Pokemon. Most notably, managing to leave a Substitute against Garganacl's Salt Cure or Corviknight's U-turn gains a lot of momentum.

  • Draco Meteor: Draco Meteor is a powerful move that can catch opposing Dragon-types off- guard and snatch a surprise KO. This Dragonite set has more than enough capability to run the timer out, so guaranteeing the number advantage is significant. It is also a significantly better offensive option against opposing Dragonite, which can avoid Encore via the use of Extreme Speed, raise its own Speed with Dragon Dance, and ignore Thunder Wave with the common Lum Berry.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Due to Dragonite’'s low Speed compared to other Dragon-types, it has a difficult time without a Fairy Tera type.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: In order to make the most use of Encore, max Speed is recommended.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Bold: A more defensive spread lets Dragonite preserve Terastallization against certain physical attackers, which makes it a noteworthy choice. In particular, max Defense Dragonite can use Roost to mitigate the damage from Choice Band Meowscarada without needing to Terastallize, and Substitute can survive Garganacl's Salt Cure.

Items

  • Leftovers Generally, Leftovers preserves Dragonite’'s longevity best, as it cancels out the damage from Sandstorm and makes timer stall easier. However, the increased usage of entry hazard setter Garchomp makes Heavy-Duty Boots a strong option.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet makes it easier for Dragonite to defeat Pokemon such as opposing Dragonite, Kingambit, and Meowscarada, and its residual damage can be used to execute a win condition, especially for sets that choose not to run Fire Spin.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Choice Band makes Dragonite both an effective late-game cleaner with Extreme Speed, and a powerful wall-breaker against foes such as Skeledirge and Dondozo.

  • Outrage versus Dragon Claw: Outrage is strong enough to potentially 2HKO Impish Dondozo after Stealth Rock damage, though it leaves Dragonite very vulnerable to getting revenge killed.

Tera Types

  • Normal: Tera Normal boosts Dragonite's revenge killing potential with Extreme Speed.

  • Flying: With Tera Blast, Tera Flying is a surprising option that lets Dragonite 2HKO defensive Pokemon such as Tera Fairy Skeledirge.

sets.name: Offensive Dragon Dance
sets.description:
• Dragonite uses both Multiscale and the unpredictability of Terastallization to become an extremely dangerous sweeper!

  • Earthquake versus Low Kick: Earthquake is a consistent option against most Steel-types, but Low Kick does better against Kingambit.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Dragonite has superb synergy with Tera Steel, resisting most of its weaknesses, and particularly helping against Fairy-types and opposing Dragon-types. When paired with Safety Goggles, this Dragonite can take advantage of Amoonguss effectively as well.

  • Fire: With Tera Fire, Dragonite deals massive damage to Corviknight with +1 Fire Punch, in addition to gaining a useful Fairy-type resistance.

Items

  • Lum Berry: With a Lum Berry, Dragonite can set up against status moves and use Outrage with less risk late game.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Avoiding damage from hazards lets Dragonite always set up with Multiscale in tow.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb doesn't fit well with Multiscale, but it's notable for allowing Tera Fire Dragonite a 75% chance to OHKO Corviknight after Dragon Dance.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description: Dragon Dance + Extreme Speed Aerilate Dragonite serves as a powerful offensive threat that can check sweepers like Chien-Pao. Earthquake hits non-Earth Eater Gholdengo and Sand Stream Garganacl, Fire Blast breaks through Fluffy Corviknight, and Ice Beam deals with Hippowdown, Garchomp, and Altaria. Heavy-Duty Boots affords the most longevity, whereas Sharp Beak and Life Orb are better suited for hyper offense teams. Dragonite does tend to struggle to break through bulky Fluffy and Intimidate walls, so it appreciates powerful wallbreakers like Sheer Force Gengar; in return, Dragonite can use Extreme Speed to cover faster offensive threats. Dragonite also appreciates teammates like Corviknight, which can provide Defog support for non-Heavy Duty Boots variants and defensively handle anti-priority users like Queenly Majesty Polteageist.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Choice Band Aerilate Dragonite serves as a potent offensive cleaner and revenge killer, capitalizing on its priority -ate Speed to threaten fast offensive Pokemon like Barraskewda and Chien-Pao. If forgoing recovery, Thunder Punch can help break through Corviknight. For the 4th moveslot, Earthquake is generally best to hit foes like non-Earth Eater Gholdnego and Kingambit, while Fire Blast is an option to break Fluffy Corviknight and Tera Blast chips neutral Fur Coat users like Hippowdown. This set appreciates Rapid Spin and Defog support from the likes of Corviknight and Iron Treads, respectively, which can also pivot Dragonite into offensive threats it normally couldn't switch into. Dragonite pairs up well with wallbreakers like Sheer Force Gengar to help break through physical walls; in return, Dragonite threatens fast offensive threats with Extreme Speed.

sets.name: Extreme Killer (Dragon Dance)
sets.description: Dragonite's high Attack stat, Dragon Dance, and Tera Normal make it a good user of Extreme Speed, being able to effectively clean late-game. Earthquake helps Dragonite eliminate Normal-resistant Pokemon such as Gholdengo, Kingambit, and Heatran. Roost improves Dragonite's longevity and enables it to acquire multiple boosts against passive opponents. Roost lets Dragonite check Volcarona and rain sweepers such as Barraskewda throughout the entire match. Ice Spinner is another choice that clears the priority-blocking Psychic Terrain and hits Great Tusk, Landorus-T, and Dragapult super effectively. Fire Punch can be used to hit bulky Steel-types not weak to Ground such as Corviknight, Mega Scizor, and Ferrothorn. An Adamant nature is usually preferred to maximize Extreme Speed's damage output, but a Jolly nature enables Dragonite to outspeed Tapu Koko and the Normal-immune Dragapult after a single Dragon Dance. Heavy-Duty Boots ensures that Dragonite will always retain Multiscale even if entry hazards are up, but if the team's entry hazard control is good, Silk Scarf is another option that boosts Extreme Speed's power. Dragonite fits well on offensive teams as a priority-using revenge killer and late-game cleaner. Entry hazard support from Great Tusk and Garchomp can help chip down bulky targets such as opposing Great Tusk into range of its attacks. Tapu Lele poses a serious threat to Dragonite, as not only does its Psychic Terrain block Extreme Speed on grounded targets, but with a Choice Scarf it can also outspeed and deal massive damage to Dragonite even after setup, especially if Dragonite has not Terastallized yet. Gholdengo is a good partner, as it can switch in on and threaten Tapu Lele and prevent the opponent from removing entry hazards. Dragonite often struggles against Unaware users such as Dondozo and Skeledirge, so Pokemon that can grab momentum against them are appreciated teammates. Rotom-W and Tapu Koko can come relatively freely on Dondozo and threaten it with a Volt Switch while Heatran and Mega Diancie can switch into and set up Stealth Rock against Skeledirge. Strong wallbreakers like Mega Medicham, Mega Charizard Y, and Zamazenta all take advantage of Pokemon that Dragonite tends to struggle with, such as Dondozo, allowing it to sweep more easily late-game.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• With a fantastic typing and priority, Azumarill makes a good choice for a team's bulky Water-type.

  • Superpower: Superpower often forces Azumarill to switch out, but its reliability against common Hydreigon Tera types is very valuable, in addition to OHKOing Kingambit.

  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner is Azumarill's best option against Amoonguss.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Azumarill a vital immunity to Will-O-Wisp, as well as letting it deal massive damage to Corviknight with Tera Blast.

  • Water: Tera Water not only makes it easier to clean weakened teams with Aqua Jet, but it also lets Choice Band Azumarill OHKO Flutter Mane with Aqua Jet.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Assault Vest Azumarill a much better match-up against Iron Bundle, no longer being weak to Freeze-Dry and OHKOing it after Stealth Rock damage with Play Rough.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Azumarill beat Breloom, Brute Bonnet, and Rotom-W.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest lets Azumarill act as a Hydreigon check; even Choice Specs-boosted Tera Electric Tera Blast fails to OHKO it. It also lets Tera Fairy Azumarill do well against Iron Bundle.

  • Choice Band: The big power boost from Choice Band gives Azumarill an 81.3% chance to OHKO Rotom-H with Aqua Jet, and pick off major foes such as Flutter Mane and Great Tusk more easily.

sets.name: Belly Drum
sets.description: Azumarill is a premier Belly Drum sweeper armed with Huge Power, a strong priority move in Jet Punch, which can be pushed to its maximum power with Tera, and wall breaking capabilities with Surging Strikes. Azumarill's Water / Fairy typing frequently gives it safe opportunities to setup Belly Drum against Dragon- and Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Weavile. Hyper Drill is a neutral coverage move that can hit Toxapex for massive damage and doesn't trigger Baneful Bunker. Other physical attackers like Kingambit and Roaring Moon appreciate Azumarill's ability to break through physically defensive walls such as Ting-Lu and Great Tusk. Azumarill is prone to chip damage from Garchomp or Rocky Helmet Toxapex, so having an attacker that can deal with both like Iron-Valiant is advised. Azumarill also can have a tough time getting in and setting up a Belly Drum, so pairing it with screens support via Grimmsnarl, Shed Tail from Cyclizar, or pivots such as Corviknight is recommended.

sets.name: Unaware Wall
sets.description:
Tera Poison prevents Quagsire from being poisoned by Grafaiai while improving its matchup versus Slither Wing and Lucario. Water Absorb sets also benefit from it improving its matchup versus Tera Grass Barraskewda and Floatzel.

Tera Steel also prevents poison, gives Quagsire the opportunity to surprise Toxtricity and Staraptor, and lets it beat Maushold. Water Absorb sets should avoid using this Tera type due to Close Combat Barraskewda beating it.

Tera Ghost lets Quagsire spinblock, keeping its entry hazards up while helping versus Lucario regardless of Quagsire's ability, all while providing an immunity to Boomburst from Toxtricity and Noivern.

sets.name: Wish Tank
sets.description:
• Umbreon’s high bulk allows it tank a slew of offensive Pokemon. In particular, it matches up extremely well against Dragapult. A naturally high bulk alongside excellent utility moves means Umbreon can generate tempo while surviving even surprise Tera-boosted attacks.

  • Foul Play: In such a physically leaning format, Foul Play is a strong reliable move to chip the opponent’s Pokemon. In particular, it punishes Swords Dance from Lum Berry Kingambit. Protect also scouts for U-turn and Tera.

  • Wish and Protect: Wish + Protect provides excellent recovery, and with Leftovers's animation as well, is great at stalling out the timer and can also keep teammates healthy.

  • Yawn: Yawn's ability to force switches generates extra Leftovers recovery and generates momentum for its teammates.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave has excellent synergy with Wish. If the opponent’s Pokemon is unable to attack on the turn Umbreon uses Wish, Umbreon can easily pass the Wish to a teammate.

  • Taunt: Umbreon can Taunt opposing walls and deny their recovery; with foes such as Hippowdon and Corviknight being especially vulnerable.

Tera Types

  • Poison: Tera Poison resists Fighting, Bug, and Fairy and provides an immunity to Toxic.

  • Steel: Tera Steel resists Bug and Fairy, is immune to Toxic, and has a decent matchup against Kingambit and Flutter Mane.

  • Fairy: In a heavily Dragon-centric metagame, Tera Fairy on defensive Pokemon is highly valuable.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Bold: This spread allows Umbreon to tank a majority of the heavily physical metagame.

  • 172 HP / 252 Def / 60 SpD / 20 Spe with Bold: If running Taunt, 20 Speed EVs outpace Skeledirge and Corviknight while retaining all-around bulk.

Abilities

  • Inner Focus: Inner Focus avoids flinches from Kingambit and Hydreigon, making it a more reliable check.

  • Synchronize: Synchronize punishes attempts to burn Umbreon.

sets.name: Bulky Supporter
sets.description:
• The given EV spread, nature and Eviolite allow Murkrow to survive an Extreme Speed from a Swords of Ruin-boosted Choice Band Dragonite, then invests the remaining EVs in Special Defense.

These are sample sets as we work on proper analyses. Stay tuned!

vgc2023.overview:
• Murkrow is one of the metagame's premier support Pokemon due to being the only Pokemon with Prankster and Tailwind. Murkrow also has a plethora of other support tools, including Haze, Taunt, and Perish Song.

  • Murkrow is commonly used with Haze alongside Pokemon that drop their own stats, such as Gholdengo or Draco Meteor Hydreigon, or to enable Earthquake Garchomp with its Flying typing. Prankster + Taunt also safely shuts down Trick Room teams, although Murkrow must be wary of a potential Fake Out or priority-blocking abilities, such as Psychic Surge from Indeedee-F and Armor Tail from Farigiraf.

  • However, Murkrow has many exploitable weaknesses, especially fearing powerful Fairy-, Ice-, and Rock-type moves in the format. It also relies heavily on its support moves, leaving it vulnerable to Taunt.

sets.name: Tailwind
sets.description:
• Foul Play punishes the metagame's strong physical attackers, most notably 2HKOing Adamant Dragonite and Garchomp. Brave Bird is an alternative option that handles Flying-weak Pokemon such as Meowscarada, Lilligant, and Breloom with ease.

  • Murkrow's Haze allows it to check dangerous threats, such as Dondozo, Nasty Plot Gholdengo, and Swords Dance Garchomp. Haze can also reset its partner's stat drops from the likes of Intimidate, Parting Shot, and Snarl, or attacks that lower the user's stats.

  • Taunt allows it to also disrupt support Pokemon such as Lilligant, Talonflame, and Amoonguss, as well as crippling Pokemon such as Iron Defense Garganacl. Quash is also a viable option to maintain speed control even in Trick Room, and it can neutralize threats such as Maushold and Garchomp in opposing Tailwind.

  • Other viable, but not as prominent, options for Murkrow include Protect and Perish Song. Protect allows it to scout the opponent and block Fake Out. Perish Song is an interesting option that gives Murkrow a win condition alongside its supportive roles and can force switches before that.

  • Eviolite gives Murkrow the bulk needed to stay on the field and disrupt the opponent with Haze and Taunt. Focus Sash can be used when Murkrow is expected to be KOed quickly, for example Murkrow can also hold Covert Cloak to bypass Fake Out.

  • 52 Speed EVs allow Murkrow to get the jump on Annihilape in Tailwind, and the overall bulk investment allows Murkrow to survive Tera Normal Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Timid Gholdengo's Thunderbolt.

  • Tera Ghost allows Murkrow to bypass Fake Out on sets not running Covert Cloak, while Tera Dark adds more power to Foul Play in rare late-game one-on-one scenarios and it keeps Murkrow's immunity to Prankster status moves.

sets.name: Defensive Pivot
sets.description: Tera Fairy lets Slowking improve its matchups against Slither Wing, Tyranitar, and Sandy Shocks. Tera Water lets Slowking power up its Surf to better threaten targets like Slither Wing and Unaware Quagsire, and it removes its weakness to Bug- and Dark-type moves from Slither Wing and Bisharp.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
Colbur Berry lets Slowking stay in against Pokemon like Iron Jugulis, Tyranitar, and Bisharp, threatening them with boosted attacks without Terastillizing.

Tera Fairy lets Slowking improve its matchups against Slither Wing and Sandy Shocks. Tera Water lets Slowking power up its Surf to better threaten targets like Slither Wing and Unaware Quagsire, and it removes its weakness to Bug- and Dark-type moves from Slither Wing and Bisharp.

sets.name: Bulky Swords Dance
sets.description: Mega Scizor leverages its great bulk and solid defensive typing to serve as a sturdy check to many Pokemon—including Weavile, Kartana, and Tapu Lele—and a solid wincon as well. U-turn allows it to serve as a pivot: easily switching it out of checks such as Gholdengo, Urshifu-R, and Mega Charizard Y, it brings in teammates like Tapu Koko and Dragapult to deal with them. Close Combat can be used to dispose of Steel-types like Ferrothorn and Heatran much more quickly, greatly denting them on the switch. The given EV spread allows Mega Scizor to survive two Close Combats from Mega Lopunny after Stealth Rock and outspeed uninvested Heatran, with the HP and Special Defense EVs helping it check Tapu Lele and Espathra. Mega Scizor's pivot support is extremely valuable to Pokemon such as Tapu Koko, Rotom-W, and Zamazenta, which all also appreciate how well it exploits defensive Pokemon such as Clodsire, Ferrothorn, and Landorus-T. Rotom-W forms a strong VoltTurn core with Mega Scizor as well, with both pivoting out on their checks and racking up solid chip damage over time. Nasty Plot Tornadus-T appreciates Mega Scizor pressuring specially defensive walls and offensive Pokemon like Weavile and Clodsire, letting it go all-in as an offensive wallbreaker with ease. Mega Scizor wearing down Rotom-W and Heatran is also particularly useful for Tornadus-T, as these Pokemon can heavily damage or cripple Tornadus-T in one way or another. Mega Scizor being completely countered by Gholdengo mandates a Pursuit trapper like Weavile or Kingambit to pressure it. Skeledirge also hard counters Mega Scizor, encouraging the aforementioned teammates as well as Garganacl and Heatran.

sets.name: Swords Dance + 3 Attacks
sets.description: This set takes on a much more offensive role, using its solid defensive typing for easy entry points against Pokemon like Weavile, Kingambit, and Espathra, setting up, and threatening the vast majority of the metagame with its strong Technician-boosted attacks. Close Combat KOes Steel-types like Heatran and Ferrothorn, as well as providing a strong neutral hit against Rotom-W. Dual Wingbeat hits Clodsire and Toxapex for reliable neutral damage, hits Zamazenta super effectively, and breaks Substitute against Shed Tail hyper offense teams and Dragon Dance Dragapult. Knock Off is an alternative to hit Gholdengo reliably and remove items like Leftovers from Rotom-W and Heavy-Duty Boots from Tornadus-T, Skeledirge, and Volcarona. This allows a teammate or Mega Scizor to wear them down much more easily. Knock Off is especially relevant in Rotom-W's case, as removing Leftovers makes it easier to put into KO range of +2 Close Combat. Running Knock Off makes Toxapex a much worse matchup, however, so Pokemon like Great Tusk and Tapu Koko that can pressure it are appreciated. Sand Tomb can be used to reliably beat Clodsire, Toxapex, and Gholdengo, preventing them from reliably checking it. Offensive Mega Scizor fits much better on hyper offense teams, which appreciate its incredibly valuable—though short-term—defensive utility. Grimmsnarl is a perfect teammate, providing dual screens to let it set up against foes like Great Tusk, Dragonite, and Landorus-T; it also pivots Mega Scizor in and appreciates it baiting in Gholdengo, which prevents Grimmsnarl from pivoting as effectively. Gholdengo itself is also a notable partner, as it appreciates Mega Scizor dispatching the most popular Dark-types in Weavile and Kingambit. Entry hazards from suicide leads like Landorus-T and Garchomp allow Mega Scizor to clean late-game, as its foes must be chipped before any sweeping is done. Entry hazards particularly help in wearing down checks like Urshifu-R and bulkier Garchomp sets. Mega Scizor struggles against bulky Steel-resistant Pokemon like Rotom-W and Volcarona; Dragonite and Dragapult can take care of the latter, switching into Volcarona to set up as it switches into Mega Scizor, whereas Great Tusk can remove Leftovers from the former, making it easier for Mega Scizor to dispatch with +2 Close Combat. Physically defensive Unaware walls in Skeledirge and Dondozo completely wall Mega Scizor, so offensive Pokemon that can bait in or wear down these foes, including Calm Mind Espathra and Iron Valiant, make for solid partners.

sets.name: Pivot
sets.description:
• Thanks to its high Attack, great defensive typing and solid bulk, Scizor is an effective bulky pivot that can also punish faster foes with Technician-boosted Bullet Punch, such as Flutter Mane, Iron Valiant, and Baxcalibur.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat is Scizor’s best option to hit opposing Steel types, while Thief is the strongest option against Gholdengo due to the Technician boost.

  • Thief Thief is a great option for hitting Gholdengo hard.

Other Options

  • Aerial Ace This is an option over Thief to hit Fighting types like Annihilape, Great Tusk, and Breloom, but leaves you vulnerable to Gholdengo.

  • Trailblaze: Besides gaining a useful Speed boost, Trailblaze does good damage to Great Tusk and Rotom-W.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band lets Scizor function as a scary late-game cleaner, especially with Tera Steel-boosted Bullet Punch. The high damage output also helps Scizor to break down walls for its teammates.

  • Assault Vest: While much less immediately threatening than Choice Band, Assault Vest lets Scizor more comfortably switch in to stray special attacks like Gholdengo’s and Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball or Rotom-W’s Volt Switch, improving its longevity.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Choice Band Scizor is a fairly good user of Terastallization, as with Tera Steel boosts Bullet Punch to terrifying levels. Tera Steel also softens Scizor’s weakness to Fire, letting it avoid the OHKO from attacks like Dragonite’s Fire Punch even after a boost.

  • Water: While Steel is Scizor’s best Tera type in most circumstances, Water turns its Fire weakness into a resistance, allowing Scizor to surprise Pokemon like Skeledirge, Iron Moth, and Volcarona.

  • Fire: A Fire Tera type functions similarly to Water, but it trades more weaknesses in general for an immunity to burn and a better matchup against Corviknight.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: This set will be up for reservation once the analysis process for Series 2 begins.

sets.name: Lum Berry
sets.description:
• Sturdy is a valuable ability in the 1v1 metagame, giving Donphan a free turn to deal damage with its good offensive stats.
  • Lum Berry allows Donphan to beat Will-O-Wisp users such as stall Arcanine and Skeledirge, preventing burns and Donphan's Sturdy from breaking.
  • Counter makes use of Sturdy, retaliating against most physical attackers that Donphan cannot KO easily, such as Chien-Pao.
  • Encore traps opposing Pokemon such as Espathra and Swords Dance Iron Hands into setup moves and locks foes such as Ting-Lu into weaker moves.
  • Donphan can beat many physical attackers with Counter, although some prediction may be required versus Pokemon that have the option of using an attacking move, such as Swords Dance Haxorus and non-Choice item Meowscarada.
  • Gunk Shot can be used to deal with Fairy-types such as Sylveon and Azumarill. However, Azumarill with Defense investment can tank a Gunk Shot, so it's not always reliable.
  • Ice Shard gives Donphan priority and finishes off foes that are at low HP. It also gives Donphan a way to deal with Dragon- and Flying-types such as Salamence, Garchomp, and Dragapult.
  • Rock Tomb lowers the opposing Pokemon's speed, Speed, letting Donphan go first and pull off a potential Encore on foes such as Attack-boosted Great Tusk.
  • The HP and Defense EVs allow Donphan to tank an Outrage from Adamant Choice Band Haxorus, and maximum Attack ensures that Donphan can hit as hard as possible. The remaining EVs are put into Speed.
  • An alternative EV spread of 8 HP / 240 Atk / 8 Def / 252 Spe with a Jolly nature only allows Donphan to tank Jolly Choice Band Haxorus, but comes with a faster Encore and Earthquake. The spread gives Donphan the capability to naturally outspeed Pokemon such as Sylveon and Azumarill.

sets.name: Calm Mind Support
sets.description:
• The old reliable special wall is still viable, but with a twist: Blissey uses Calm Mind so it isn't entirely passive and fully takes advantage of Tera Blast giving it STAB no matter what type it is.

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball is still a reasonable option for dealing good damage to Gholdengo and Dragapult regardless of Blissey's Tera type, and also breaks Mimikyu's Disguise.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave is Blissey's most consistent way of spreading paralysis, though it's vulnerable to Taunt and Gholdengo switch-ins.

  • Fling with Light Ball: This allows Blissey to paralyze Gholdengo, Ground-types, and users of Taunt alike, though Covert Cloak holders are immune to the effect. Fling also gets rid of Choice items from Trick users.

  • Trick with Lagging Tail: This cripples even Electric-types and is a more direct way of getting rid of troublesome Choice items that Blissey would normally succumb to.

Other Options

  • Fling with Flame Orb: This is a surprising option to burn common Blissey switch-ins like Great Tusk, though failing to use it right away will force switching out to get rid of the burn.

  • Fling with Toxic Orb: This is as close as it gets to Blissey regaining Toxic, though getting poisoned is devestating if Blissey is the last Pokemon around, making it a risky option.

Tera Types

  • Dark: Dark Tera type not only gives Blissey a less exploitable STAB move against Gholdengo, but it also ruins Espathra's attempts to break through Blissey with Stored Power, at least forcing a Calm Mind war instead of a total loss.

  • Ghost: The Fighting-type immunity comes in handy for Blissey, though it does become more vulnerable to Gholdengo.

  • Flying: Under Flying Tera type, Blissey gains a handy resistance to Fighting and no longer has to worry about Fissure from Dondozo.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: With Ice Scales, Blissey is a titanic special wall that checks prominent attackers like Gholdengo and Iron Bundle; Good as Gold is an alternative to stop Taunt users like Chi-Yu, which otherwise take advantage of Blissey. Thunder Wave lets Blissey cripple foes such as Corviknight and Kingambit, which could otherwise switch into it free of charge, while Calm Mind helps Blissey keep up with foes like Nasty Plot Gholdengo, ensuring they do not break past it. Shadow Ball lets Blissey hit Ghost-types like Dragapult and Gholdengo, denying them setup opportunities. Heavy-Duty Boots is preferred to avoid entry hazard chip damage from repeated switch-ins, but Leftovers provides passive recovery. Physically defensive teammates like Fur Coat Avalugg and Flogres help cover the physical attackers that threaten Blissey, like Aerilate Dragonite and Dragon Rush Dragapult. Slow but powerful wallbreakers such as Slither Wing and Ceruledge appreciate Blissey paralyzing offensive foes, giving them more chances to wallbreak.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
Tera Flying gives Tyranitar a Ground immunity and a Fighting and Bug resistance, helping it versus Pokemon such as Slither Wing, Gastrodon, and Gengar.

Tera Fairy similarly helps Tyranitar versus Slither Wing and Gengar while letting it pressure boosted Salamence and Haxorus.

Tera Rock is a more offensive option that increases the power of its Stone Edge while still having defensive application versus Gengar by removing its 4x weakness to Focus Blast and retaining its Special Defense boost in sand.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description: Tera Flying lets Tyranitar set up against Pokemon like Donphan and Slither Wing while preventing it from being revenge killed by First Impression from Lokix and Slither Wing.

sets.name: Stealth Rock
sets.description: Tera Fairy removes Tyranitar's Focus Blast weakness to potentially beat Gengar while letting it check Slither Wing. Tera Flying is an alternative that lets it beat Donphan as a Stealth Rock setter while similarly providing a Fighting resistance.

sets.name: Drizzle Bird
sets.description:
• Hydro Pump versus Surf: Hydro Pump significantly weakens opponents when rain-boosted, often picking up surprise KOs. Surf is the far more reliable option.

  • Hurricane versus Roost; The choice between Hurricane and Roost is a matter of coverage versus longevity. Hurricane gives Pelipper a powerful secondary STAB move, while Roost takes advantage of its decent physical bulk, increasing its staying power. This is particularly useful in weather wars against Torkoal

Tera Types

Ground: Tera Ground gives Pelipper an immunity to Volt Switch, which is often used against it early-game. This wastes a turn for the opponent and gives Pelipper the chance to safely U-turn or deal massive damage with a rain-boosted Hydro Pump.

Grass: Tera Grass is a viable option for Rotom-W, which primarily uses Hydro Pump on lead while providing a Volt Switch resistance.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA with Quiet: With 0 Speed IVs, this is used to underspeed uninvested Hippowdon, giving Pelipper the initial advantage in weather wars.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpA with Relaxed: This spread gives Pelipper a better matchup against dominant, powerful physical attackers like Choice Band Dragpault and Extreme Speed Dragonite.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest: This offensive spread can be used to outspeed uninvested Corviknight and others in that Speed tier.

Items

  • Eject Button: This extra method of pivoting makes it much easier to switch Pelipper in just for getting rain up.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs can be used to take advantage of Pelipper's powerful STAB moves.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry provides longevity on defensive sets.

vgc2023.overview:
• Pelipper's role is primarily to set rain for its teammates, but functions it as an offensive support Pokemon with fully accurate Hurricanes and access to Tailwind and Wide Guard.

  • Rain boosts the power of Water-type teammates such as Palafin, Floatzel, and Drednaw, and it also weakens Fire-type moves for Fire-weak partners such as Amoonguss, Gholdengo, and Kingambit.

  • Pelipper's overall bulk is lacking, particularly specially, and super effective attacks like Thunderbolt from Gholdengo or Rotom-W are capable of OHKOing it.

sets.name: Pelipper
sets.description:
• Hurricane's full accuracy in Rain makes it mandatory on Pelipper. It provides consistent damage and threatens the Grass-type Pokemon that resist Water.

  • Hydro Pump is Pelipper's best Water-type attack but can be forgone if accuracy is a concern. Helping Hand paired with a fast Water-type Pokemon can compensate for the lack of reliable Water-type damage.

  • Wide Guard can be used over Protect to answer ubiquitous spread moves such as Gholdengo's Make it Rain and Sylveon's Hyper Voice.

  • Focus Sash ensures Pelipper survives attacks from Pokemon that might otherwise outspeed and OHKO it, such as Hydreigon and Annihilape. Damp Rock extends the uptime of Pelipper's rain-reliant teammates, allowing them to beat bulkier teams without requiring repeat switch-ins.

  • 252 Speed EVs with a Timid nature allow Pelipper to outspeed the entire metagame with Tailwind, as well as some notable Choice Scarf threats such as Annihilape.

  • A Ground Tera type grants Pelipper an immunity to Electric and a resistance to Rock, which are its main concerns. With a Grass Tera type, it instead resists Electric, but this grants an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder.

sets.name: Rain Setter
sets.description: Pelipper is a staple pick on rain teams thanks to its ability, Drizzle. Its physical bulk combined with Scald lets it check and potentially cripple foes such as Mega Lopunny, Mega Scizor, and Great Tusk. Hurricane is an alternative to Defog on teams that use Tornadus-T for entry hazard control, which offers better neutral coverage and the ability to hit foes such as Tangrowth and Tera Grass Heatran. Pelipper also operates as a slow pivot with U-turn, which is greatly appreciated by the team's wallbreakers to ensure that they can enter the field safely. Tera Ground offers an Electric immunity for threats such as Tapu Koko, whereas Tera Steel offers a strong defensive typing, letting Pelipper check Pokemon like Extreme Speed Dragonite in a pinch. As the premier rain setter, Pokemon that rely on rain to boost their power or operate effectively within it, such as Mega Swampert, Floatzel, Barraskewda, and Urshifu-R, make for common teammates. Mega Swampert offers a valuable Electric immunity for Pelipper, checking foes such as Tapu Koko. Tornadus-T can provide entry hazard control with Defog, letting Pelipper enter the field and summon rain without having to fear taking hazard damage. Ferrothorn takes advantage of Pelipper's typing and ability to form a solid defensive core and provide a robust blanket check for opposing rain. In return, Pelipper alleviates Ferrothorn's massive Fire weakness by setting rain, and it can check threats that Ferrothorn fails to cover, such as Mega Lopunny.

We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Since it can sleep foes without restriction, Breloom is a monstrous foe that every team needs to prepare for!

  • Bulldoze: This is Breloom's best option against Gholdengo and provides valuable speed control.

  • Spore: As good as Spore is, it's well prepared for enough by threats such as Gholdengo, Garganacl, and Lum Berry that going without it can make sense.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb provides speed control and ensures that Breloom is not walled by Flying-types such as Dragonite.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat lets Breloom muscle past bulkier threats more easily, such as Tera Steel Garganacl.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: Breloom doesn't Terastallize often, but Fighting Tera is a good choice for picking off foes more easily with Mach Punch.

  • Ground: Tera Ground-boosted Bulldoze has a 93.8% chance to OHKO 4 HP Gholdengo, making Breloom a situational lure. It also severely punishes Rotom-W that attempt to Volt Switch out, and Hippowdon that don't Terastallize.

  • Fire: With Tera Blast, Tera Fire provides an alternative way to get past Gholdengo, avoids getting burned by other foes, and gives bulkier Breloom a chance against Flutter Mane.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Since Breloom's bulk isn't very good, Focus Sash is the most reliable way to fire off Spore.

  • Loaded Dice: Guaranteeing 4 hits from Bullet Seed can be quite useful for bulkier Breloom sets, clinching a OHKO on Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle regardless of them running Substitute.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: If using Focus Sash, maximizing Speed is important to deal with slower foes that might invest in Speed, such as Corviknight and Skeledirge.

  • 252 HP / 180 Atk / 76 SpD: This bulkier spread makes sense if using Loaded Dice and Swords Dance, letting Breloom survive one hit from Iron Bundle or Choice Specs Flutter Mane with the correct Tera type.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description: The EV spread is to avoid the 2HKO from Choice Band Weavile and the OHKO from +2 Salazzle after Stealth Rock and 3 layers of Spikes.

sets.name: Belly Drum
sets.description: The Special Defense EVs ensures Tera Steel Hariyama avoids the KO from Rotom-H's Overheat after using Belly Drum and 1 layer of Spikes. The Defense EVs are to live Primeape's Drain Punch after Hariyama has used Belly Drum.

vgc2023.overview:
• Torkoal has exclusive access to drought, making it the most consistent sun setter in the format. Its rock-bottom Speed and sun-boosted Eruption make it an absolutely terrifying Trick Room sweeper, capable of chunking or outright KOing a majority of the metagame.

  • Heavy support in the form of Trick Room and/or Chlorophyll + After You Lilligant is mandatory. Torkoal also welcomes priority protection from the likes of Farigiraf and Indeedee, both of which set Trick Room as well. While Torkoal has high enough bulk to shrug off most priority moves, it hates having the power of Eruption lowered, and Fake Out wastes its Trick Room turns.

  • Torkoal faces stiff competition from Armarouge due to Armarouge's superior support capabilities and better coverage options, in spite of its lower overall damage output. To make matters worse, Tera Grass, Pyschic, or Dark Armarouge and Ceruledge wall most Torkoal sets endlessly, using Flash Fire, Wide Guard, and Terastillization removing their weakness to Earth Power. However, Armarouge pairs well with Torkoal by giving it protection from Earthquake and enjoying sun itself.

  • Most Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Assault Vest Hydreigon can take everything Torkoal can dish out and threaten it in return. Guts Hariyama can protect against Garchomp's Earthquake with Wide Guard and threatens an OHKO on Garchomp. Lilligant can put them to sleep and threatens Garchomp with Leaf Storm. Hatterene is a more offensive Trick Room setter that threatens the Dragon-types with Dazzling Gleam.

sets.name: Trick Room Offense
sets.description:
• This set makes full use of Torkoal's nuclear power. Eruption vaporizes nearly anything without a resistance or immunity to Fire after Terrastilization. Heat Wave gives it a mostly-reliable spread option after taking damage. Earth Power hits opposing Fire-types and gives Torkoal a single-target option to get around Wide Guard.

  • Tera Fire is the go-to option to maximize Torkoal's damage. Tera Flying and Grass removes its weaknesses, which helps greatly against the ever-frequent Ground-type attacks, but are generally not worth it.

  • Solar Beam is an option to hit Water-types meaningfully and to hit Rock- and Ground-types a little harder than Earth Power. Tera Blast is a niche option if Torkoal is running Tera Flying, turning the tables on Tera Grass Armarouge and Ceruledge attempting to wall it. Choice Specs would push Torkoal's offensive capabilities onto another planet, but it makes Torkoal even easier to exploit with Wide Guard, Flash Fire, and attacks in general—it can't viably run Protect.

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description: Tera Steel lets Salamence set up against Pokemon like Scream Tail, Grafaiai, and Choice-locked Noivern and Staraptor. Tera Flying powers up Salamence's Dual Wingbeat, letting it OHKO Gastrodon at +1 without locking into Outrage.

sets.name: 3 Attacks Roost
sets.description:
Tera Fairy removes Salamence's weakness to Stealth Rock and Noivern's Draco Meteor while retaining its good matchup against Slither Wing.

Tera Steel lets it check Grafaiai, Maushold, and Staraptor, and revenge kill Lucario even when weakened.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Specsmence Returns
sets.description:
• Salamence finds a niche for itself among other special attacking Dragon-types due to an incredible ability in Intimidate and a useful typing that provides a handy Fissure immunity.

  • Hurricane versus Air Slash: Hurricane's accuracy may not be very reliable, but the sheer damage output makes it worth it. Air Slash is much weaker than Hurricane, but the more reliable accuracy and flinch chance make it a reasonable alternative. It becomes especially attractive if using Tera Flying.

  • Hydro Pump: If not using Tera Fairy, Hydro Pump is a reasonable choice that deals massive damage to Hippowdon and Fire-types without risking Draco Meteor.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Not only does Tera Fairy give Salamence an edge against many Dragon-types, but it also pairs extremely well with Intimidate, transforming Salamence into an effective hit-and-run threat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel comes in handy against Dragon- and Fairy-types alike, though the added weaknesses to Ground and Fighting make it less effective at taking physical hits with Intimidate.

  • Flying: Air Slash becomes much easier to justify with Tera Flying, and if you're willing to risk it, Hurricane can be used to become almost impossible to wall with Choice Specs.

  • Fire: Tera Fire doesn't offer as much defensive utility, but the powerful STAB attacks come in handy against Steel-types like Corviknight.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon trades defensive advantages for an extremely powerful Draco Meteor that catches defensive foes like Dondozo by surprise.

Items

  • Choice Specs: With Salamence already standing at a decent Speed tier, it can get away with Choice Specs, making it extremely difficult to wall outside of using Blissey.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf trades wallbreaking power for the ability to get the jump on major offensive threats, such as Dragapult, Meowscarada, and Garchomp.

sets.name: Physically Offensive
sets.description:
• Salamence is somewhat overshadowed by other physical Dragon-types like Roaring Moon and Dragapult, but it has a trick up its claws: Dual Wingbeat, which OHKOes Breloom and Meowscarada through their Focus Sash.

  • Earthquake versus Fire Blast: Earthquake is the best option for hitting Steel-types such as Gholdengo hard, but Fire Blast is Salamence's best shot at 2HKOing Corviknight.

  • Dragon Dance: After a boost, Dual Wingbeat's Focus Sash slaying powers go into overdrive, being able to bust through Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Great Tusk.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, a boosted Dual Wingbeat has a 75% chance to OHKO offensive Mimikyu through its disguise! It also means Salamence no longer needs a boost to OHKO Great Tusk and Flutter Mane.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Tera Blast Salamence OHKO Azumarill and Iron Bundle, and potentially 2HKO Dondozo after Stealth Rock damage.

Abilities

  • Intimidate: While Salamence isn't particularly bulky, Intimidate makes setting up far easier when paired with a Flying Tera type that removes Salamence's common weaknesses.

  • Moxie: With Moxie, Salamence has the potential to seriously punish Breloom leads or snowball through teams even without Dragon Dance.

sets.name: Mixed Attacker
sets.description:
• Salamence's great mixed offenses, Intimidate, and decent Speed give it a niche as a powerful wall breaker.

  • Dual Wingbeat: Dual Wingbeat lets Salamence OHKO Breloom regardless of its Focus Sash, something very few Pokemon can do.

  • Draco Meteor: Draco Meteor deals massive damage to Dondozo, usually doing more than 50% to physically defensive ones.

  • Substitute: Substitute makes the Dondozo match-up even better, making Yawn a non-issue. It's also a good way to scout Terastallization against slower threats.

Tera Types

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type covers a lot of Salamence's weaknesses and makes dealing with Mimikyu, Iron Bundle, and Flutter Mane much easier.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Salamence a great match-up against most Dragon-types, and pairs especially well with Intimidate to turn Salamence into a good hit-and-run attacker.

  • Fire: With a Fire Tera type, Salamence gains a resistance to Fairy-type attacks and deals massive damage to Assault Vest Magnezone.

  • Electric: Tera Electric gives Salamence a great tool against Dondozo with Tera Blast.

  • Dragon: While this Tera type fails to help Salamence much defensively, it makes Draco Meteor 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Tera Flying increases Staraptor's damage against targets such as Tinkaton, 2HKOing it. Tera Normal can be used to remove its Stealth Rock weakness. However, Double-Edge isn't as spammable as Brave Bird due to the presence of Ghost-types.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: Tera Flying increases Staraptor's damage against targets such as Tinkaton and Quagsire, possibly OHKOing the latter. Tera Ground can be used to provide a resistance to Stealth Rock and mitigate chip damage while taking advantage of the fact Choice Band Staraptor already has very little defensive counterplay.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Swift Weasel
sets.description:
• Wave Crash: This is your main offensive option. When further boosted by rain, Tera Water, and Choice Band, it becomes one of the most powerful physical moves in the game, 2HKOing the likes of Bold Amoonguss and OHKOing maximum Defense Corviknight. Mystic Water is an option for flexibility but sacrifices the listed KOs.

  • Liquidation versus Waterfall: Liquidation is a secondary option, and it's preferred when facing frailer offensive teams due to the significant recoil drawback of Wave Crash. However, Waterfall is worth considering for its possible flinch chance.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet allows Floatzel to maintain offensive presence outside of rain, as well as being a great response to opposing priority moves, such as Kingambit's Sucker Punch.

  • Rain Setter: Pelipper's rain is mandatory for both Swift Swim and maximum damage output.

Tera Types

  • Water: Tera Water massively bolters Floatzel's damage output, and the weasel simply doesn't have the bulk needed for more defensive options.

EV Spreads

  • 60 HP / 252 Atk / 196 Spe:196 Speed EVs are used to outspeed the entire tier in rain, including Choice Scarf Dragpault.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Maximum Speed investment outspeeds Hydreigon and Mimikyu outside of rain, in addition to tying with Salamence, at the cost of having less buffer HP for Wave Crash recoil.

sets.name: Specially Defensive Wall
sets.description:
Tera Poison allows Gastrodon to resist Fighting-type attacks from Slither Wing and Hawlucha, as well as Power Whip from Tsareena. It also gains a Toxic immunity, which lets it beat foes like Grafaiai, and it resists other miscellaneous attacks such as Play Rough from Mimikyu and First Impression from Lokix.

Tera Ghost allows Gastrodon to stop Rapid Spin users such as Tsareena and Donphan from removing its entry hazards, although it should be wary of the latter's high Attack. It also resists Slither Wing's STAB moves and shuts down Swords Dance Lucario.

Tera Steel lets Gastrodon resist Normal-type attacks from Toxtricity, Maushold, Noivern, and Staraptor, although the latter two carry coverage options to hit it super effectively.

sets.name: Physically Defensive (Ground)

sets.name: Specially Defensive (Water)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description: Gastrodon finds itself a valuable role in National Dex primarily off its invaluable Water and Electric immunities, allowing it to handle terrifying rain sweepers such as Floatzel and Mega Swampert and answer Rotom-W perfectly. Scald lets Gastrodon threaten a burn against otherwise safe switch-ins such as Ferrothorn and Dragonite. Toxic better threatens defensive Pokemon such as opposing Gastrodon, Skeledirge, and Tornadus-T. Earthquake threatens Pokemon like Heatran, Clodsire, and Gholdengo. Relaxed should be selected as Gastrodon's nature if using Earthquake to not lower its damage output; Bold should be used otherwise. Tera Fairy can be used in a pinch to grant Gastrodon a resistance to Fighting against Urshifu-R and Barraskweda and a Dark resistance against Kingambit. The given EV spread maximizes Gastrodon's physical bulk to better take on the likes of Floatzel, Mega Swampert, and Urshifu-R. Gastrodon fits best on balance and bulky offense teams, which appreciate its defensive qualities while being able to supplement its passivity with offensive wallbreakers. Pokemon such as Tornadus-T and Gholdengo can switch into Grass-type coverage from Pokemon like Kartana and Ferrothorn; In return, Gastrodon provides entry hazard support to wear down answers such as Mega Tyranitar, Kingambit, and Clodsire. Strong, fast wallbreakers like Mega Diancie, Iron Valiant, and Zamazenta love having Gastrodon as a fallback measure against the myriad of Water-type revenge killers on rain such as Floatzel and Mega Swampert. If Gastrodon opts to use Spikes, it likes having Stealth Rock setters such as Heatran and Mega Diancie as partners to form an effective entry hazard-stacking core.

sets.name: Tailwind Setter
sets.description:
• The given EVs and nature allow Drifblim to outspeed Choice Scarf Chi-Yu after Unburden or in Tailwind, and retain enough Attack to 2HKO Chi-Yu with Acrobatics, with the remaining EVs invested to improve overall bulk.

This is a sample set as we work on proper analyses. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Offensive Stealth Rock
sets.description: Garchomp serves as an excellent wallbreaker that possesses great defensive utility, having an Electric-type immunity and being a check to Pokemon like Heatran and Volcarona. Outrage with Dragonium Z muscles through Pokemon like Great Tusk, Tangrowth, and Ting-Lu. Garchomp fits best on offensive teams; Pokemon like Volcarona, Mega Charizard Y, and Tapu Koko benefit from it breaking through Pokemon like Toxapex, Clodsire, and Dragonite. Tapu Koko makes a stellar partner because it can pivot on Garchomp targets in Clodsire, Gastrodon, and Gliscor. In return, Tapu Koko threatens Corviknight and Slowbro, two major roadblocks for Garchomp. Pokemon like Mega Scizor and Kingambit can pressure revenge killers such as Iron Valiant, Weavile, and Dragapult thanks to their strong priority while taking several attacks from them. Rotom-W switches into Pokemon that threaten Garchomp such as Great Tusk and Tornadus-T. Garchomp can take care of Pokemon Rotom-W pivots out on such as Gastrodon, Ferrothorn, and Gholdengo.

sets.name: TankChomp
sets.description: Garchomp possesses great role compression and is a good check to contact attackers like Mega Scizor, Dragonite, and Mega Lopunny. Toxic can cripple switch-ins such as Landorus-T, Tangrowth, and Rotom-W. Dragon Tail can stop any setup attempts from Volcarona, Mega Scizor, and Dragonite lacking Ice Spinner and can wear down Pokemon like Corviknight, Rotom-W, and Landorus-T. Alternatively, Flamethrower can rip through Pokemon like Kartana, Mega Scizor, and Ferrothorn. Tera Ghost lets Garchomp spinblock Great Tusk and switch into Fighting-type moves from Pokemon like Mega Medicham and Zamazenta, while Tera Water grants resistances to Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Ice- and Water-type moves from Weavile, Floatzel, and Urshifu-R as well as neutrality to Fairy-type attacks from Iron Valiant and Mega Diancie. Tera Steel gives it a Toxic immunity and improves Garchomp's matchup against Tapu Lele, Kartana, and Dragapult. The given Speed EVs with a Jolly Nature allows Garchomp to outspeed Timid Gholdengo, while maximizing its physical bulk. Teammates like Mega Scizor, Gholdengo, and Volcarona can cover Garchomp's Ice and Fairy weaknesses and threaten out a majority of Garchomp checks such as Iron Valiant, Weavile, and Mega Diancie. In return, Garchomp can switch into Rock- and Fire-type Pokemon like Heatran, Mega Tyranitar, and Volcarona. Knock Off Kingambit and Weavile support Garchomp by crippling common Defoggers like Tornadus-T and Landorus-T.
