With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Expanding Force
sets.description:
• Armarouge's combination of powerful STAB moves, excellent coverage, Weak Armor, and Psychic Terrain makes it strong candidate to use Focus Sash.

  • Psychic Terrain Psychic Terrain is a powerful setup move for Armarouge thanks to Expanding Force; it also protects Armarouge from priority moves after Weak Armor triggers.

  • Expanding Force: Expanding Force under Psychic Terrain, especially with Tera Psychic, is a devastatingly powerful move.

  • Armor Cannon: This helps Armarouge defeat Steel-types that resist Expanding Force.

  • Aura Sphere: Aura Sphere is excellent coverage against the Dark-types.

  • Destiny Bond: This is a good alternative to forcefully take down threats that Armarouge can’t easily KO.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball hits the specially defensive Water-types Armarouge might struggle to defeat otherwise, most notably Gastrodon.

Tera Types

  • Psychic: With a boost from Tera Psychic, Expanding Force OHKOes even relatively bulky foes such as Garchomp and Flutter Mane. With Stealth Rock, Expanding Force still achieves most notable KOs without Tera Psychic, but the extra damage is still appreciated.

  • Fighting: In cases where setting up Psychic Terrain proves to be more difficult, Tera Fighting provides a useful resistance to Sucker Punch and powers up Aura Sphere.

vgc2023.overview:
• Armarouge is an amazing Trick Room setter and powerful offensive Pokemon. Few Pokemon resist Psychic + Fire, and Armor Cannon and Expanding Force in Psychic Terrain are very powerful attacks. With minimum Speed, Armarouge in Trick Room outpaces a large portion of the metagame.

  • Armarouge appreciates Pokemon that can help it set Trick Room, like Choice Scarf Annihilape thanks to Final Gambit, and redirectors such as Amoonguss and Indeedee-F; Indeedee-F is a particularly good teammate due to Psychic Surge massively improving Expanding Force.

  • Hydreigon, Garchomp, and Tyranitar are all strong and common Pokemon that can give Armarouge a hard time. Fighting-type teammates like Hariyama, Paldean Tauros-W, and Annihilape help check Hydreigon and Tyranitar. Garchomp can be checked by Pokemon like Rotom-W, Abomasnow, and Tera Steel Hydreigon.

sets.name: Trick Room
sets.description:
• Armor Cannon is a nuclear single-target attack that can OHKO Amoonguss, OHKO Kingambit, and even give a good shot to 2HKO Grimmsnarl through Light Screen. Alternatively, Heat Wave is a strong spread move option alongside Life Orb, which compensates for its considerably lower power than Armor Cannon. Being a spread move, it doesn't mind redirection users like Rage Powder Amoonguss or make Armarouge choose between targeting one of two Protect users.

  • Psychic is used when not paired with Indeedee-F. Expanding Force is preferred alongside Indeedee-F, which makes Expanding Force much stronger and a spread move via Psychic Terrain.

  • Wide Guard protects Armarouge and its teammates from attacks like Garchomp's Earthquake and Tyranitar's Rock Slide. Energy Ball lets Armarouge OHKO Rotom-W and TeraGround Garchomp with Tera Grass,and it has a good chance to 2HKO Tyranitar with Life Orb, even without Terastallizing. Aura Sphere 2HKOes Hydreigon and Tyranitar, and with Life Orb, it OHKOes them with minimal damage.

  • Life Orb makes Armarouge very powerful, securing OHKOs against Pokemon like Maushold, slightly chipped Hatterene, and, with Expanding Force in Psychic Terrain, slightly chipped Garchomp and Rotom-W. Safety Goggles grants Armarouge immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder.

  • A Grass Tera type gives Armarouge Ground and Water resistances, which are good against Garchomp and Rotom-W. Tera Dark is a good option to improve matchups against Ghost- and Psychic-types like Ceruledge, Skeledirge, and opposing Armarouge, make Armarouge immune to Prankster Murkrow's Taunt, and give it a resistance to Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Dark Pulse can be used alongside Tera Dark to more heavily damage Ghost- and Psychic-types, though outside of opposing Armarouge, Life Orb Psychic can usually 2HKO them.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: Choice Scarf Armarouge is a passable revenge killer that outspeeds naturally fast Pokemon like Cinderace, Noivern, and Chien-Pao, threatening them with its high-Base Power STAB attacks. Moreover, it can clean up late-game easily thanks to Psychic Surge, which protects it from common priority attacks such as Dragonite's Extreme Speed, Slither Wing's First Impression, and Kingambit's Sucker Punch. Trick cripples bulky foes it can't immediately threaten like Blissey, Florges, and Garganacl. Focus Blast hits Chi-Yu and Roaring Moon, while Psyshock 2HKOes Clodsire. Utility moves in Destiny Bond and Will-O-Wisp can also be used, with the former checking setup sweepers like Baxcalibur and Dragonite and the latter punishing switch-ins. Wallbreakers like Greninja can overwhelm shared checks and appreciate Armarouge's Psychic Terrain protecting them from the likes of Ceruledge's Shadow Sneak and Dragonite's Extreme Speed. Armarouge's susceptibility to entry hazards makes teammates like Defog Corviknight and Rapid Spin Great Tusk valuable options.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Bulk Up Sweeper
sets.description:
• Bulk Up Ceruledge makes excellent use of both its respectable bulk and Bitter Blade's high recovery. By changing its typing to a more defense oriented one, while maintaining the Fire immunity thanks to Flash Fire, Ceruledge can set up Bulk Ups on a variety of common Pokemon, ranging from Corviknight, Kingambit, Azumarill and Gholdengo.

  • Taunt: Taunt lets Ceruledge set up Bulk Up without needing to fear common phasing moves (with the exception of attacking moves such as Dragon Tail), as well as opposing setup moves such opposing Bulk Up and Iron Defense, provided you outspeed.

  • Shadow Sneak Priority of some form is always nice to have on a Pokemon, which makes Shadow Sneak an easy contender for the last move. Gaining extra added strength against Pokemon such as Flutter Mane, Dragapult and Annihilape is certainly charming.

  • Grass Tera Blast: This allows Ceruledge to eliminate Dondozo more quickly. While Taunt can shut down Dondozo's Yawn, it cannot shut down Fissure. The only way to beat Dondozo would be to eliminate it as quickly as possibly, which Grass Tera Blast aids with.

  • Flame Charge: Flame Charge provides Ceruledge an extra net of safety against potential Scarf users and Annihilape, who are capable of turning the tides against it. While normally, Ceruledge is prone to faster Taunt + Bulk Up users and Scarfed Trick, Flame Charge helps mitigate both of those weaknesses.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Ceruledge can be a status spreader in games where it can't set up as easily. It also helps Ceruledge set up more easily against threats such as Unaware Clodsire.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy helps Ceruledge's matchup against prominent Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon.

  • Grass: An immunity to Spore and a resistance to Water makes Grass the most notable Tera type for this set. Flash Fire eliminating one of Grass's many weaknesses is also noteworthy.

  • Fire: Increasing Bitter Blade's power will always be a valuable trait. Eliminating Ghost's weaknesses to Ghost and Dark also allows Ceruledge to set up more comfortably.

  • Bug: Tera Bug is similar to Tera Grass, but in exchange for losing the Water resistance and maintaining the Rock weakness of Fire / Ghost, Ceruledge can tank Volcarona's Bug Buzz with significantly more ease.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def with Impish: Investing into Defense prepares Ceruledge and its mediocre physical bulk for the physical-biased metagame. Bulk Up will boost its Defense, but it can struggle to take some physical hits even after a boost, and its special bulk is naturally high.

  • 252 HP / 252 Spe with Jolly: A faster spread helps Ceruledge outspeed other Bulk Up users, like Annihilape opting to invest in bulk. Being faster, more often than not, lets Ceruledge win these matchups with ease.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD with Careful: While most threats in the metagame at the moment are physical, a specially defensive spread is still noteworthy for its ability to surprise Hydreigon.

sets.name: Focus Sash Attacker
sets.description:
• With a stellar offensive typing, a unique set of attacks, Weak Armor allowing it to outspeed a large part of the metagame, and its immunity to Extreme Speed and Mach Punch, Ceruledge proves itself to be a very solid Focus Sash option.

  • Bitter Blade: Bitter Blade's recovery can make Focus Sash usable even if entry hazards chip it. If Ceruledge is brought down to 1 HP, a +2 Bitter Blade can heal it to the point that it can tank an extra attack.

  • Close Combat versus Shadow Claw: Close Combat hits the Normal-, Dark-, and Rock-types that resist Ceruledge's STAB combination. Still, Shadow Claw is a noteworthy choice to guarantee the KO on Mimikyu and let Ceruledge pressure Skeledirge. Note, however, that maximum Defense Skeledirge can recover more than Shadow Claw's damage, barring critical hits, and a Terastallized Skeledirge can completely wall this set.

  • Swords Dance versus Destiny Bond: As powerful as Swords Dance boosted attacks from Ceruledge are, the abundance of Unaware Pokemon, primarily Dondozo, has made some players opt to use Destiny Bond to attempt Dondozo—makes Destiny Bond viable to snag surprise kills. KOs. Destiny Bond can also make the matchup against KOing common Sucker Punch Pokemon, such as Meowscarada and Kingambit, easier to win without having to rely on predictions. less prediction reliant.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant's added damage output is valuable, but Jolly allows Ceruledge to outspeed non-Scarf Gholdengo, and gives it a chance at outspeeding Modest Rotom formes and Glimmora. All of the mentioned examples are Special Attackers, meaning Ceruledge's Weak Armor often does not trigger in these matchups.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Giving Bitter Blade an extra push in damage is quite useful, giving Ceruledge more recovery.

  • Normal: Normal is an exceedingly common Tera Type on Ghost types due to the immunity it brings to the table. Ceruledge makes particularly excellent use of Normal Tera by resisting both Steel and Fairy, making it very difficult for Gholdengo and Mimikyu to click anything other than a Ghost type move when facing off against Ceruledge.

  • Fighting: Giving extra reach pwer to Close Combat, a powerful option against Pokemon such as Hydreigon, makes Fighting a solid choice for a Tera Type.

vgc2023.overview:
• Ceruledge is a strong Bulk Up sweeper in Series 1. The combination of Bulk Up's Defense boost and Bitter Blade's healing help Ceruledge stay healthy during a sweep.

  • Ceruledge's unique defensive qualities let it set up in the face of Pokemon like Torkoal, Maushold, and Arcanine, and Tera Grass lets it set up against even more Pokemon. Pokemon that can help Ceruledge set up like Rage Powder Amoonguss can make good teammates.

  • Ceruledge struggles against some of the metagame's best Pokemon like Hydreigon, Tyranitar, and Garchomp. Paldean Tauros-A, Sylveon, and Pawmot check Hydreigon and Tyranitar for Ceruledge. Tera Steel Hydreigon, Rotom-W, and Abomasnow check Garchomp.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• Shadow Sneak finishes off weakened Pokemon, Focus Sash users like Kilowattral, hits opposing Ceruledge, and lets Ceruledge revenge kill Ghost-weak Pokemon like Gholdengo. Tera Blast + Tera Grass lets Ceruledge hit Fire-resistant Pokemon like Tyranitar, Rotom-W, and Garchomp.

  • Clear Amulet prevents Ceruledge from being weakened by Intimidate users like Paldean Tauros-A, Arcanine, and Gyarados, as well as Parting Shot Grimmsnarl.

  • Grass is easily Ceruledge's best Tera type, giving it a Water and Ground resistance for the likes of Garchomp and Rotom-W and making it immune to Amoonguss's powder moves. Flash Fire lets Ceruledge do extremely well against opposing Fire-types, especially when Terastallized, as it will shed its weakness to super effective coverage moves like Torkoal's Earth Power and opposing Ceruledge's Shadow Sneak.

sets.name: Swords Dance
sets.description: Ceruledge is an incredibly powerful wallbreaker due to its potent offensive typing, boosted Fire-type attacks, and stellar coverage. Shadow Sneak makes up for Ceruledge's lackluster Speed and can finish off faster Pokemon. Solar Blade and Close Combat provide coverage against foes that tank Ceruledge's STAB moves, such as Garganacl, Great Tusk, Chi-Yu, and Roaring Moon. Alternatively, Will-O-Wisp gives up coverage for the ability to cripple switch-ins like Garchomp and Hippowdon. Orichalcum Pulse is the preferred ability due to the Attack bonus, but Desolate Land provides it with some defensive utility by checking opposing Primordial Sea users. Due to Ceruledge's frailty, it appreciates pivoting and entry hazard removal from teammates like Corviknight, Great Tusk, and Iron Treads. Strong special attackers such as Greninja can pair with Ceruledge to break down each other's checks, such as Garganacl and Garchomp and Blissey and Corviknight, respectively.

sets.name: Choiced Attacker
sets.description: Ceruledge's sun-boosted Bitter Blade offers a combination of power and longevity scarcely seen in a wallbreaker. Choice Band Bitter Blade 2HKOes the majority of the metagame, while Choice Scarf Ceruledge outpaces Chien-Pao and Cinderace. Close Combat hits Garganacl and Well-Baked Body Steel-types, and Solar Blade hits Great Tusk. Will-O-Wisp cripples many of Ceruledge's switch-ins, such as Garganacl. On Choice Band sets, a Jolly Nature is useful for outpacing opposing Ceruledge and Gholdengo. The additional power offered by Orichalcum Pulse is significant, but Desolate Land can be used to offensively check Barraskewda. Ceruledge's Stealth Rock weakness and lackluster bulk make Defog and pivot support from a teammate like Corviknight very valuable. Great Tusk's offensive presence and Knock Off support greatly complements Ceruledge's own offensive prowess and burn spreading capabilities; defensive cores can quickly crumble under the weight of entry hazards, burn chip, and repeated subjection to Bitter Blade and Headlong Rush. Fast special attackers like Greninja and Noivern help deal with faster threats and Garganacl.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Fat Bellibolt
sets.description:
• Bellibolt's stats allow it to be deceptively bulky, and a pure Electric typing is not terrible on a defensive Pokemon with reliable recovery and pivoting.

  • Parabolic Charge: Parabolic Charge gives Bellibolt a more constant stream of recovery, though it is much less punishing than Discharge.

  • Volt Switch: Volt Switch maintains initiative when predicting switches after bringing Bellibolt in on something that it walls, such as defensive Gholdengo or Corviknight.

  • Chilling Water: Chilling Water punishes Garchomp and Hippowdon on the switch-in.

  • Thunder Wave: This disrupts opponents if Bellibolt doesn't have Discharge.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: Tera Blast hits common Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Baxcaliber after Terastallizing into the Fairy typing.

  • Soak: Soak catches Electric resistant foes on the switch-in and forces them to either switch out or Terastallize early, with major targets including Garchomp and Baxcalibur.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Terastallizing into the Grass typing flips the matchup against Ground-types on its head, turning their attacks from super effective into a resisted hit while still charging Bellibolt's next Electric hit; this allows Bellibolt to wall Hippowdon and Garchomp and absorb Spores vs Breloom and Amoonguss, effectively walling them as well.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type comfortably walls Dragon-types, removing a lot of their offensive pressure.

  • Water: Water is just generally good to have as a defensive Tera type. It also gives Bellibolt STAB on Chilling Water for slightly more damage.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 244 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to live two Glaive Rushes from Adamant Baxcalibur if it is not in a position to Terastallize. The physical bulk lets Bellibolt always survive Life Orb Garchomp's Earthquake, and after Terastallization into a neutral type, it becomes a 3HKO. 28 Speed EVs allow Bellibolt to outspeed 4 Speed Hippowdon.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers provides long term passive recovery alongside Slack Off, which can make Bellibolt very difficult to remove. Leftovers also removes any chance of a 2HKO from powerful physical threats such as Baxcalibur.

  • Sitrus Berry: A short-term HP booster that effectively gives Bellibolt 125% HP, making it a good back-up option if Leftovers is already in use.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet Bellibolt can switch into and punish physical attackers in a more passive manner; the chip damage can also break Focus Sash and weaken things into range of Electromorphosis-boosted attacks.

sets.name: Tactical Bellibolt
sets.description:
• Bellibolt can be quite unassuming, and specially offensive Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Rotom may see it as a free opportunity to get into position. Assault Vest turns the tides against them with Electromorphosis + Parabolic Charge, which makes Bellibolt seem impossible to remove for certain Pokemon. It's also a decent check against Iron Bundle.

  • Grass or Fairy Tera Blast: Tera Blast is important coverage to have; with a Fairy Tera type, Bellibolt reliably checks non-Tera Steel Dragons.

  • Muddy Water versus Chilling Water: Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric for much-needed coverage. Alternatively, Chilling Water weakens common switch-ins such as Garchomp and Baxcalibur, allowing you to reposition your team more safely.

  • Acid Spray: This threatens non-Steel type switch-ins and also allows Bellibolt to effectively use it’s ability without having to take damage first. Its also a powerful tool against Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

  • Sucker Punch: While weak, Sucker Punch catches Focus Sash Pokemon and/or deals chip damage on turns where Bellibolt is guaranteed to go down.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Fairy Tera Bellibolt offensively checks big threats like Roaring Moon and Dragapult by walling their non-Tera sets and nabbing surprise KOes.

  • Grass-type: Grass Tera Bellibolt can stay in versus common Pokemon such as Hippowdon can Breloom, sponge their attacks, and either chunk them or survive and reposition.

  • Electric-type: Maximizing Parabolic Charge damage is a viable option.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 28 Def / 180 SpA / 44 SpD / 28 Spe: This spread is to avoid the 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Rotom-W and Hydreigon's Hydro Pump and Draco Meteor, respectively. 28 Speed EVs allow Bellibolt to outspeed 4 Speed Hippowdon. 28 Defense EVs are enough for Bellibolt to survive Focus Sash Garchomp's Earthquake, which notably becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into into a typing without a weakness to Ground.

sets.name: Bespectacled Bellibolt
sets.description:
• With such good natural bulk, Bellibolt can easily survive hits from common threats and nab surprise KO's in return with a cheeky Choice Specs set.

  • Discharge / Thunderbolt: Discharge or Thunderbolt is the preferred primary STAB move, as either one takes advantage of Choice Specs more than Parabolic Charge. With an Electromorphosis boost, Bellibolt can 2HKO common switch-ins without having to Terastallize, like Dragapult.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: Tera Blast is important for coverage; with a Fairy typing you reliably check non-Tera Steel Dragons. Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric.

  • Muddy Water versus Parabolic Charge: Muddy Water lets Bellibolt win the one-on-one against Hippowdon. Parabolic Charge should be used if run Tera Electric with Muddy Water already available in a different moveslot.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy let Bellibolt turn the tables on bulky Dragon-types such as Baxcalibur and Roaring Moon by scoring a surprise KO on a potential setup attempt.

  • Grass-type: Tera Grass turns Bellibolt's only weakness into a resistance and gets surprise OHKOs on threats such as physically defensive Hippowdon.

  • Electric-type: Tera Electric + Choice Specs turns Bellibolt into an offensive behemoth, and with an Electromorphosis boost it can OHKO resists like Dragapult, Hydreigon, and specially defensive Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 28 Def / 196 SpA / 28 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to survive Choice Specs Draco Meteor from Hydreigon and Earthquake from Focus Sash Garchomp; Garchomp's Earthquake becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into a typing without a weakness to Ground. The Speed EVs outspeed 4 Speed Hippowdon, while the SpA EVs are enough to OHKO physically defensive Hippowdon with Muddy Water.

sets.name: Offensive Electric Immunity (Flying)
sets.description: These are the sample sets before we work on new analyses. These will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

vgc2023.overview:
• Kilowattrel stands out as one of the best Tailwind setters in the current metagame. Its base 125 Speed stat lets it set Tailwind first, with very little Prankster Tailwind Pokemon stopping it from doing so.

  • Kilowattrel has a respectable base 105 Special Attack stat and a good offensive typing, allowing it to tackle the likes of Meowscarada and Gyarados well.

  • Kilowattrel appreciates immediately hard-hitting partners such as Choice Specs Gholdengo and Garchomp to break through opposing teams. Gholdengo is great in particular thanks to its immunity to Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

  • Kilowattrel is particularly frail, meaning it often only gets to set Tailwind and fire off a single attack before it faints. It also means in late-game scenarios, it is unreliable at dueling the meta's most common attackers like Gholdengo and Hydreigon.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Air Slash is Kilowattrel's primary Flying-type STAB move of choice due to its higher accuracy than Hurricane, though the latter may be seen on rain teams.

  • Discharge is a good spread option when next to a Ground- or Electric-type partner like Garchomp or Rotom-F. Volt Switch allows Kilowattrel to use its high base Speed to pivot into a partner that can better use the extra Speed from Tailwind.

  • Competitive acts as an Intimidate-deterrent for physically attacking partners such as Garchomp, Baxcalibur, and Ceruledge.

  • Focus Sash is a must-have, as Kilowattrel is incredibly frail and unable to take any super effective or strong neutral attacks such as Baxcalibur's Icicle Crash and Tera Normal Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

  • Kilowattrel rarely Terastallizes, but when it does, it prefers to use same type Tera to boost the power of one of its STAB moves.

sets.name: Offensive Pivot
sets.description:
Poison Touch is used to give Grafaiai a chance to poison while using Knock Off or U-turn. Black Sludge should be used if using Switcheroo to let it cripple switch-ins such as Tinkaton and Gastrodon; Heavy-Duty Boots are otherwise preferable to stay healthier versus Gengar when entry hazards are up.

Grafaiai should very rarely be Terastillized, as its typing is necessary to check Gengar and it will be unable to break past any checks even after powering up its Gunk Shot.

sets.name: Prankster Utility
sets.description:
Prankster lets Grafaiai use a priority Parting Shot versus faster targets such as Noivern and Choice Scarf Sandy Shocks. It can also trap certain Pokemon such as Salamence and Gengar into moves such as Dragon Dance and Substitute, respectively, with Encore.

Grafaiai should very rarely be Terastillized, as its typing is necessary to check Gengar and it will be unable to break past any checks even after powering up its Gunk Shot.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Sun Attacker
sets.description:
• Tera Fire Scovillain's damage under sun is absurd, managing to barely KO even Fire-resistant targets. Most notably, its ability to defeat most Pokemon, even powerful Dragon-types, without fearing surprise Terastallizations makes Scovillain a charming offensive option.

  • Overheat and Fire Blast: Overheat combined with Tera Fire and Choice Specs guarantees the KO on Garchomp without bulk EVs, and OHKO offensive Roaring Moon after Stealth Rock damage. Against the frailer Dragapult, Tera Fire and Fire Blast is enough to earn the KO. It's recommended to run both Fire STAB moves because Overheat's added damage can be necessary to guarantee certain KOs, but its stat drop can be fatal.

  • Solar Beam versus Leaf Storm: Solar Beam nails the few bulky Water-types that can survive Scovillain's absurd attacks, most notable examples being notably Gastrodon and Assault Vest Azumarill. However, Leaf Storm can be used in its stead for the ability to OHKO Hippowdon, despite it summoning sand.

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower is perfectly accurateand is typically more than enough to nip off frailer foes.

  • Substitute: In spite of the type matchup, Scovillain is deceptively weak to Kingambit thanks to Sucker Punch. Additionally, many Pokemon will use Protect in front of Scovillain to waste sun turns— most notably Espathra and Dondozo. Against all of these foes, a well-timed Substitute can guarantee the win.

Tera Types

  • Fire: It is almost mandatory to run Tera Fire on this Scovillain set. Tera Fire guarantees KOs on most Dragon-types.

  • Ghost: The abundantly common Dragonite is incredibly strong against Scovillain. Should Stealth Rock support be deemed enough to let Scovillain sweep teams reasonably, even without Tera Fire, using Tera Ghost to gain an immunity to Extreme Speed can be very useful.

  • Rock: Tera Rock with Tera Blast can be a decent alternative to Tera Fire, as it gives Scovillain excellent coverage and also provides a much-needed countermeasure to Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

sets.name: Moody Ace
sets.description:
• The metagame's abundance of Unaware Pokemon makes it difficult to maneuver Moody Pokemon in general. On top of that, Scovillain is held back by the powerful Dragon-types that resist its STAB combination. However, Scovillain still carves a niche for itself by being the only Moody Pokemon with excellent recovery moves, Leech Seed and Ingrain, allowing it to win a variety of matchups.

  • Protect and Substitute: Protect and Substitute are mandatory to get the most opportunities to activate Moody. Once you gain enough Defense or Special Defense boosts that Scovillain's Substitute can tank an attack without breaking, it tends to be easy to win the game. Note, however, that Protect, Substitute, and Leftovers's animation make Scovillain very vulnerable to losing via timer.

  • Flamethrower: With enough Moody boosts, Scovillain's Flamethrower tends to be enough to break through an entire team. There are very few Pokemon that are immune or quadruply resistant to Fire, and Flamethrower has good PP and accuracy, which makes it an easy pick.

  • Giga Drain: Unlike Flamethrower, Giga Drain gets shrugged off by a lot of Pokemon, even at +6, notably Corviknight and Dragonite. However, an attacking move that helps recover HP lost from Substitutes helps it gain gives Scovillain more mileage off of Moody. Giga Drain is also notable to more reliably defeat Dondozo, one of the Unaware Pokemon that would give Scovillain a lot of trouble otherwise.

  • Leech Seed: Leech Seed combined with Protect, Substitute, and Leftovers helps Scovillain restore HP while collecting Moody boosts, as well as chipping Pokemon it'd otherwise have trouble against, such as Clodsire.

  • Ingrain: Ingrain is an alternative recovery option that makes Scovillain impervious to phazing moves. When purely considering recovery, it's more reliable than the inaccurate 90% accurate Leech Seed.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: Tera Blast with Tera Fairy is an excellent option that helps remedy Scovillain's Dragon susceptibility, particularly making the Infiltrator Dragapult and Roaring Moon matchup easier.

Tera Types

  • Water: The Water resistance helps Scovillain beat Dondozo. Even though Dondozo ignores Scovillain's Defense boosts via Unaware, with Tera Water, Scovillain's Substitute can tank a Wave Crash. Tera Water also keeps the Scovillain's Steel resistance, unlike Tera Grass, which makes it easier to check Scizor—a common priority user that people attempt to use to check Moody Pokemon.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy mitigating Scovillain's weakness to Dragon-types is massively helpful.

EV Spreads

  • 180 HP / 220 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 100 Spe with Bold: This spread bolsters Scovillain’s physical bulk. Notably, Tera Water Scovillain's Substitute manages to survive Dondozo's Wave Crash with this spread. The Speed allows Scovillain to outspeed slow Baxcalibur and Gholdengo, as well as Dragapult with one Moody Speed boost. The HP is adjusted to make maximum use of Leftovers, with the resulting stat having a remainder of 1 when divided by 16. The remaining EVs are split between Special Attack and Special Defense because, at level 50, investing 8 EVs in either stat has no benefit over investing 4.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
Espathra is a threatening sweeper due to the combination of Stored Power, Calm Mind, and Speed Boost, beating many Pokemon such as Corviknight, Iron Valiant, and Rotom-W. Dazzling Gleam can be used to take down Dark-types such as Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon. Protect can be used to safely secure Speed boosts, increasing Stored Power's damage as well as accruing extra Leftovers recovery. It increases momentum against faster threats such as Dragapult, Chien-Pao, and Meowscarada. Both Roost and Substitute are alternatives that let Espathra capitalize on the switches it forces, and they give it more Calm Mind setup opportunities. They also block Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao and Kingambit. With Tera Fairy, Espathra resists Dark-type attacks alongside powering up Dazzling Gleam. Tera Blast can be run over Dazzling Gleam with Tera Fighting, as it checks Steel-types such as Iron Treads, Kingambit, and Corviknight while also removing its Dark and Ghost weaknesses.

Espathra functions best as a late-game cleaner on hyper offense teams. Dual screens support from teammates such as Grimmsnarl is appreciated, due to its poor defensive typing. Common entry hazard setters, such as Glimmora, Great Tusk, and Garganacl, provide Espathra with chip damage, which is vital in ensuring an OHKO on Iron Valiant and Choice Band Chien-Pao. Support from Great Tusk and Iron Treads is also appreciated, as they can check Gholdengo, something Espathra struggles with. Similarly, they also can provide entry hazard removal, which supports it even further. Teammates such as Dragon Dance Roaring Moon and Dragon Dance Dragonite can wear down Pokemon such as defensive Gholdengo and Kingambit to the point where Espathra can clean late-game. Orthworm is a fantastic partner, providing Shed Tail support, alongside entry hazards, the latter of which gives Espathra more setup opportunities. Pokemon such as Breloom and Volcarona can provide utility for Espathra with Spore and Will-O-Wisp, giving it opportunities to set up. Espathra struggles with strong priority moves such as Extreme Speed from Dragonite, Ice Shard and Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao, Bullet Punch from Scizor, and Sucker Punch from Kingambit. Espathra also can be difficult to set up, as it has a rather low power level prior to boosting, and it tends to over-rely on Terastallization in order to sweep, due to its poor defensive typing.

sets.name: Calm Mind

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Speed Passer
sets.description:
• Espathra is the only option for the coveted Speed Boost + Baton Pass combination, which can be extremely deadly for setting up sweeps!

  • Lumina Crash: Lumina Crash ensures that Espathra isn't totally shut down by Taunt, and the guaranteed -2 Special Defense drop helps against Unaware walls.

  • Hypnosis: While extremely risky, putting a foe to sleep lets Espathra easily stack up on boosts.

  • Some Teammates: While most Pokemon love getting Baton Pass boosts, especially consider Pokemon that resist Espathra's common weaknesses, such as Hydreigon, Roaring Moon Sylveon, and Kingambit. Corviknight is also worth considering due to Power Trip.

  • EV Spread: The given EV spread outspeeds Choice Scarf Hydreigon after one turn of Speed Boost.

Tera Types

  • Espathra should usually avoid Terastallizing if possible, since its point is to help other Pokemon sweep. Consider these two options as fairly situational.

  • Normal: With a Normal Tera type, Espartha can set up against its Ghost types and isn't worried about Shadow Sneak anymore.

  • Ghost: Ghost Tera type makes Espartha immune to Extreme Speed, making passing against Dragonite much easier.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash is the best way to guarantee passing at least one Speed boost, though it's a lackluster option for passing multiple boosts compared to other items.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is the easy option to recommend since it pairs well with Protect and Substitute.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry should be used if Espathra is planning on passing Speed to teammates that want Leftovers, such as Skeledirge and Garganacl.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
• With Calm Mind and Speed Boost rapidly increasing Stored Power's damage output, Espathra is a dangerous wincon against bulkier teams, as it even overwhelms Unaware foes.

  • Dazzling Gleam: This provides coverage against Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon.

  • Protect versus Substitute: Protect is the most reliable way to get a free turn of Speed Boost. Substitute is a riskier option for Speed Boost stalling, but it severely punishes passive Pokemon and works extremely well on dual screen teams.

  • EV Spread: The given EV spread allows Espathra to outspeed Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle after one turn of Speed Boost.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: When paired with Tera Blast, Tera Fighting is Espathra's only hope of defeating Kingambit.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera type makes setting up on Hydreigon a much more realistic scenario and severely punishes Choice-locked Dragon-types like Dragapult.

  • Dark: Tera Dark provides gives Espathra a valuable Shadow Sneak resistance and does a better shot of defeating weakened Gholdengo.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description: This set will be up for reservation once the analysis process for Series 2 begins.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description: Calm Mind Espathra is one of the most threatening Pokemon on hyper offense teams, able to quickly spiral out of hand when teams lack hard counters to it. With Speed Boost + Calm Mind, even resistant foes fall to Stored Power once it gets a few turns to set up, like Tapu Lele and Heatran. Dazzling Gleam allows Espathra to hit Dark-types such as Weavile, Mega Tyranitar, and Kingambit. Tera Blast is a solid alternative with Tera Water to hit Mega Tyranitar, Ting-Lu, Heatran, and Kingambit much harder, but at the cost of requiring Terastallization to be effective. Roost prevents Espathra from being worn down quickly, and it allows it to easily accrue boosts on Pokemon such as Tornadus-T, Landorus-T, and Mega Diancie. Substitute lets it avoid crippling status from Toxapex, Heatran, and Gastrodon, allowing it to use them as setup fodder. Lastly, Protect lets Espathra safely accrue boosts and Leftovers recovery, and it can notably beat chipped Dragapult head-on without prior boosts. Water is the primary Tera type for its amazing defensive use, notably letting Espathra tear through rain teams with ease, unable to be revenge killed by Barraskewda and Floatzel's Aqua Jet. Water also lets it resist Scizor's Bullet Punch, and the Dark and Ghost neutralities help against Pokemon like Dragapult and Kingambit. Steel trades away the Water resistance and Tera Blast utility for an immunity to Toxic, as well as resisting Mega Scizor's U-turn and Dragonite's Extreme Speed, preventing them from revenge killing Espartha. The given EV spread allows Espathra to outspeed Dragapult at +1, with the remaining EVs in bulk letting it set up more easily. Dual screens greatly facilitate Espathra, allowing it to easily set up on offensive Pokemon, making both Tapu Koko and Grimmsnarl amazing partners, with the former also setting Electric Terrain to activate Espathra's Electric Seed. Cyclizar's Shed Tail allows Espathra to avoid status from the likes of Toxapex, Heatran, and Rotom-W, as well as phazing from Garchomp's Dragon Tail. Dedicated entry hazard leads such as Landorus-T, Annihilape, and Glimmora also work really well with Espathra, as they quickly wear down Espathra's checks like Kingambit and Ting Lu into KO range of its attacks. Fellow setup attackers such as Mega Gyarados, Volcarona, and Dragonite break down teams to facilitate a late-game sweep with Espathra. Espathra is greatly bothered by Dark-types such as Mega Tyranitar, Kingambit, Tera Dark Clodsire, and Ting-Lu, making Ghost-types such as Dragapult and Gholdengo great partners alongside it, as they wear down their shared checks. Iron Valiant is a notable partner with Electric Seed sets, as it's also able to take advantage of Electric Terrain via Quark Drive, as well as pressuring Clodsire and Gholdengo, dissuading the former from Terastallizing.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description: Tera Ghost lets Tinkaton spinblock, check Slither Wing, and surprise Pokemon like Tyranitar trying to hit it with Earthquake. It is, however, undesirable to Terastillize Tinkaton, due to needing its typing to check a wide range of threats such as Grafaiai, Noivern, and Maushold.

sets.name: Swords Dance + Two Attacks
sets.description:
Protect lets Tinkaton freely use Gigaton Hammer multiple times, rack up extra passive recovery, and scout moves from Choice-locked Pokemon such as Slither Wing. Encore is an option that locks Pokemon such as Quagsire and Gastrodon into their recovery move, generating free turns.

Tera Dark lets Tinkaton eat a hit from Choice Specs Gengar more comfortably and removes its Ground weakness, which helps against Gastrodon and Quagsire. It is, however, undesirable to Terastillize Tinkaton, due to needing its typing to check a wide range of threats such as Grafaiai, Noivern, and Maushold.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description:
• Tinkaton boasts an impressive support movepool alongside a fantastic typing in Fairy / Steel.

  • Encore: Encore can open up opportunities for teammates, locking foes into status moves or attacks that a teammate resists.

  • Thunder Wave: With Mold Breaker, Tinkaton is capable of paralyzing Gholdengo and Garganacl with Thunder Wave.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Flying Tera makes Tinkaton immune to Ground, which can be useful in avoiding Earthquake from the likes of Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Tera Ground Baxcalibur.

  • Fire: Fire Tera turns Tinkaton's Fire-type weakness into a resistance, allowing it to use Encore on Volcarona.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 164 Def / 20 SpD / 76 Spe with Careful: The HP and Defense investment lets Tinkaton survive Adamant Dragonite's Earthquake into Extreme Speed. The Special Defense investment allows Tinkaton to survive one Timid Choice Specs Fire Blast from Hydreigon, two Modest Choice Specs Shadow Balls from Dragapult, and three uninvested Shadow Balls from Gholdengo. The Speed investment allows Tinkaton to outspeed a paralyzed non-Choice Scarf Hydreigon.

Items

  • Air Balloon: Air Balloon lets Tinkaton set up Stealth Rock against other common entry hazard setters such as Garchomp and Glimmora without the use of Flying Tera and pairs incredibly well with Encore.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash allows Tinkaton to get a Thunder Wave off even against powerful attacks from the likes of Terastallized Garchomp, Hydreigon, and Dragapult.

sets.name: Offensive Support
sets.description:
• Despite Tinkaton's low offensive stats, it can still perform as an offensive Pokemon thanks to Gigaton Hammer's enormous 160 Base Power and Swords Dance.

  • Encore: Encore is a fantastic support move, potentially locking foes into resisted moves after a switch-in or denying slower, bulkier foes their recovery moves for a few turns.

  • Play Rough versus Knock Off: Play Rough is Tinkaton's best option against Roaring Moon, and thanks to Mold Breaker, Tinkaton can hit Unaware Dondozo with boosted Play Rough. Meanwhile, Knock Off is Tinkaton's best attack against Gholdengo.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Flying Tera turns Tinkaton's Ground-type weakness into an immunity, allowing it to use Encore on moves like Earthquake and Fissure from foes such as Garchomp, Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Dondozo.

  • Steel: Steel Tera capitalizes on Gigaton Hammer to make it deal as much damage as possible.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 236 Atk / 36 Def / 4 SpD / 228 Spe with Jolly: This spread outspeeds Annihilape and allows Tinkaton to survive a +1 Dragon Claw + Normal Tera Extreme Speed from Dragonite after Terastallizing.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers has great synergy with Encore, allowing it to set up while healing off some of the damage from weak moves.

  • Focus Sash: Holding a Focus Sash guarantees that Tinkaton can get at least one move off even against super effective attacks aimed at it.

  • Air Balloon: With Air Balloon, Tinkaton can give Ground-type foes like Great Tusk and Hippowdon issues before even Terastallizing.

vgc2023.overview:
• Tinkaton is primarily a bulky attacker, but it also has an amazing defensive typing and Fake Out, giving it good defensive utility.

  • Tinkaton does extremely well against Murkrow teams, including Pokemon common on them like Annihilape, Hydreigon, Meowscarada, Maushold, and Murkrow itself. This makes it a very good partner for Dondozo + Tatsugiri teams, which feel pressured by Murkrow's Haze. Many of the aforementioned Pokemon are also very common on teams without Murkrow, so Tinkaton checking them well is broadly useful.

  • Mold Breaker + Fake Out Tinkaton does well against dedicated Trick Room teams because its Fake Out bypasses Oranguru's Inner Focus and Farigiraf's Armor Tail, and it can OHKO Mimikyu through Disguise.

  • Tinkaton struggles with the extremely common Fire-types, as well as Garchomp and Steel-types like Corviknight and Scizor, which wall it entirely. Water-types help deal with the majority of its counters, especially Rotom-W.

sets.name: Bulky Attacker
sets.description:
• Knock Off hits Pokemon that resist both its STAB moves like Gholdengo, Armarouge, and Ceruledge and can cripple Pokemon with the item removal, especially Dondozo.

  • Tinkaton has many opportunities to use Swords Dance, especially because opponents will often use Protect consecutively in front of it, expecting a Fake Out or Gigaton Hammer. It's also a good move to use on the Gigaton Hammer recharge turns.

  • Assault Vest turns Tinkaton into a sponge against special attackers, which helps against common Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Gholdengo.

  • Sitrus Berry lets Tinkaton run Protect, which helps it stall out Gigaton Hammer recharge turns. This also pairs well with Swords Dance, which is similarly convenient to have on the recharge turns.

  • Mold Breaker is mainly good when used with Fake Out, as the ability lets Tinkaton flinch Dragonite, Farigiraf, and Oranguru. Mold Breaker also bypasses Mimikyu's Disguise.

  • Own Tempo is valuable because there are multiple good Intimidate users: Arcanine and Gyarados, as well as Paldean Tauros-A, Paldean Tauros-B, and Salamence. If you're not very worried about dedicated Trick Room teams or Dragonite, this is a good way to improve your matchup against bulkier teams.

  • Tera Steel is by far the best Tera type for Tinkaton, as it makes Gigaton Hammer very powerful, even doing good damage to targets that resist it. For example, it 2HKOes maximum HP Talonflame.

sets.name: RegenVest
sets.description: Tinkaton's decent bulk with Assault Vest and incredible defensive typing allow it to pivot into and check special attackers such as Noivern and Gengar. Knock Off is Tinkaton's most important move, as it hits Gholdengo and removes crucial items from common switch-ins such as Corviknight, Skeledirge, and Iron Treads. Skitter Smack lowers the Special Attack of bulky Calm Mind users such as Florges and powerful wallbreakers such as Chi-Yu, allowing Tinkaton and its teammates to more easily handle these threats. Play Rough and Ice Hammer both hit Dragon-types such as Roaring Moon hard; Play Rough also dents Fighting-types such as Slither Wing while Ice Hammer deals huge damage to Garchomp, Dragonite, and Clodsire. Physically defensive walls such as Hippowdon can deal with the physical wallbreakers that threaten Tinkaton, like Ceruledge and Great Tusk, and appreciate it relieving pressure against Greninja. Slower attackers such as Great Tusk, Baxcalibur, and Quaquaval benefit from Tinkaton handling fast revenge killers such as Noivern and Gengar for them.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Wave Crash is a very strong STAB move. With Stealth Rock support and Tera Water's power boost, it crushes walls Palafin normally might struggle to break, like Toxapex and Corviknight, and always OHKOes Miraidon.
  • Close Combat is a strong, reliable coverage move that hits many of Palafin's checks like Corviknight and Koraidon for solid damage, while also hitting Water-types barring Toxapex for neutral damage.
  • Ice Punch allows Palafin to hit Dragon-types like the very common Koraidon and Miraidon while also hitting Water Absorb Clodsire. However, it cannot OHKO Koraidon and is not guaranteed to OHKO Miraidon.
  • Zen Headbutt allows Palafin to hit Toxapex super effectively, as well as potentially OHKOing Koraidon and having fantastic odds to 2HKO Miraidon.
  • Tera Water powers up Palafin's Water-type moves and allows Palafin to achieve feats like 2HKOing Miraidon with Jet Punch from full HP if rain is up.
  • Choice Band Palafin functions best on offensive teams to revenge kill threats like Flutter Mane or to break walls for its teammates mid-game. Remember, base Palafin needs to be used very early in a game to transform into its Hero Form.
  • Pelipper is a great partner for Palafin, as it checks Koraidon decently and replaces its sun with rain, strengthening Palafin's powerful Water-type attacks.
  • Koraidon sets up sun and resists Water-type attacks Palafin throws at it, so Palafin appreciates teammates that threaten Koraidon, like Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane. Also, Palafin is weakened by the sun Koraidon sets up, so it is best not to pair Palafin and Koraidon together.
  • Miraidon is a good partner, as it destroys Alomomola, a great counter to Palafin, and can safely bring Palafin onto the field with either U-turn or Volt Switch. Miraidon also appreciates Palafin threatening Ground-type Pokemon that can take Miraidon's Electric-type attacks, like Ting-Lu, Iron Treads, and Clodsire.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description: This is a sample set before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: This looks like a job for Palafin
sets.description:
• Palafin's stats are middling, but after switching out once it will forme change into Palafin-H, which boasts the highest base Attack in the format, making it an effective wall breaker and revenge killer.

  • Jet Punch: With Jet Punch, Palafin-H becomes an excellent revenge killer, being able to take down important threats such as Flutter Mane, Iron Moth, and Great Tusk.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat is good coverage, hitting Rotom-W for neutral damage and covering Roaring Moon and Meowscarada.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: An Adamant nature increases the damage Wave Crash and Jet Punch inflict, making Palafin-H a more effective wall breaker and revenge killer. A Jolly nature enables Palafin-H to outspeed Mimikyu and Hydreigon.

Tera Types

  • Water: A Water Tera type boosts Jet Punch and Wave Crash, making Palafin-H a potent late-game cleaner.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type turns all of Palafin-H's weaknesses into resistances, giving it a favorable matchup against Rotom-W, and making it immune to Spore from Breloom and Brute Bonnet.

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description: Overcoat is an option over Filter so Venomoth can't try to muscle past a weakened Revavroom with Sleep Powder and enough sleep turns.

sets.name: Shift Gear
sets.description: Tera Ground covers Steel- and Fire-types such as Klefki, Coalossal, and Paldean Tauros-F, but Tera Fire can be used for Bronzong.

sets.name: Shed Tail
sets.description: This is a sample set before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Shed Tail (Dragon)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Shed Tail
sets.description: Shed Tail, Regenerator, and good Speed give Cyclizar a unique role on offensive teams: safely bringing in powerful attackers like Cinderace, Noivern, and Dragonite multiple times per battle. Draco Meteor KOes opposing Cyclizar and picks off weakened foes. U-turn lets Cyclizar pivot out without self-damage, healing from Regenerator to potentially use Shed Tail again later. Rapid Spin and/or Knock Off provide further utility. Choice Scarf + Shed Tail is preferred against Chien-Pao and other fast threats, but Heavy-Duty Boots can be used to avoid entry hazard damage and the Choice lock. Cyclizar benefits greatly from a strong physical wall or Dazzling user to deal with priority attackers like Dragonite; strong attackers like Cinderace and Noivern are valuable for dealing with phazers like Hippowdon, or a Good as Gold user like Skeledirge or Gholdengo can block phazing moves outright.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
Tera Fairy allows Orthworm to resist Fighting-type attacks and wall foes like Slither Wing, Lucario, and Hawlucha.

Tera Ghost retains the greater matchup vs the aforementioned Fighting-types while also being immune to Staraptor's Double Edge and Gengar's Focus Blast. Tera Ghost also allows Orthworm to spin block and threaten out Tsareena and Donphan.

sets.name: Shed Tail
sets.description: Tera Ghost allows Orthworm to spinblock against foes like Tsareena while setting up entry hazards. Tera Ghost also prevents Slither Wing, Lucario, and Gallade from hitting Orthworm super effectively, allowing it to safely pass a Shed Tail. However, it is much more advisable to Terastallize a different threat as Orthworm will be nearly out of comission after a single Shed Tail.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: IronPress
sets.description:
• Thanks to Earth Eater, Orthworm can wall sets of many physical Dragon-types like Garchomp and Baxcalibur.

  • Heavy Slam versus Iron Head: Heavy Slam can 2HKO offensive Dragapult, OHKOs Flutter Mane, and deals much more damage to Iron Valiant, while Iron Head is superior for Dragonite.

  • Rest and Chesto Berry: Rest is an option with Chesto Berry to heal Orthworm in a pinch, giving it better longevity.

  • Shed Tail: Shed Tail gives Orthworm use when IronPress isn't as effective. The surprise factor comes at the price of the reduced effectiveness of IronPress.

  • Substitute: Substitute stops Salt Cure damage from Garganacl and phazing from Garchomp's Dragon Tail.

Other Options

  • Earthquake is an option to hit Gholdengo, but it won't 2HKO, so Recover is still a problem.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry allows two uses of Shed Tail.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is a consistent option, especially in conjunction with Substitute.

Tera Types

  • Poison: Tera Poison provides a key Fighting resistance and single weakness and maintains a key resistance to Flower Trick, letting Orthworm preform better against Meowscarada, Great Tusk, and Iron Valiant.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides a Fighting resistance and Dragon immunity, turning Dragon Tail Garchomp into setup bait, and dealing with Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Roaring Moon.

EV spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: This EV spread makes Orthworm much less likely to be 2HKOd by Life Orb Dragapult.

  • 252 HP / 116 Def / 140 Spe with Impish: This spread can be used to outspeed Adamant Kingambit and most Corviknight and Skeledirge. This can be very useful if using Shed Tail.

sets.name: Shed Tail Support
sets.description:
• Orthworm's good physical bulk and ability make it a great user of Shed Tail, and a reliable Stealth Rock user.

  • Body Press: Body Press has a good chance to OHKO offensive Meowscarada, and threatens Kingambit and Roaring Moon.

  • Heavy Slam versus Iron Head: A Steel-type STAB move helps hit some Ghost-types like Mimikyu and Flutter Mane, who are OHKOed by Heavy Slam, and deals massive damage to Iron Valiant. Iron Head is an alternative for heavy foes like Dragonite.

  • Spikes: Orthworm can also set Spikes, but this compromises its ability to pass Shed Tail.

  • A Special Teammate: Many Pokemon can benefit from Orthworm's Shed Tail. One example is Air Balloon Gholdengo, which puts a lot of pressure on defensive foes when behind a Substitute.

Tera Types

  • This Orthworm isn't usually meant to Terastalize, since that's better served by the teammates its passing a Substitute to.

  • Poison: Tera Poison leaves Orthworm with only one fairly rare weakness, and aiding it against former threats like Great Tusk and Iron Valiant.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Orthworm a Fighting resistance, as well as a way to absorb Garchomp's Dragon Tail while still staying in.

EV spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD: This spread maximizes Orthworm's physical bulk. Running a Speed IV of 0 may be tempting, but being outsped by bulky Brute Bonnet is risky.

  • 252 HP / 116 Def / 140 Spe with Impish: This spread outspeeds Kingambit, and most Skeledirge and Corviknight. Outspeeding Kingambit and Corviknight prevents Taunt from stopping Shed Tail, and let's Orthworm bring in a teammate against Torch Song.

  • 252 HP / 44 Def / 212 Spe with Jolly: This spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom and Jolly Brute Bonnet. Mach Punch still does a lot, but thanks to Sitrus Berry, Orthworm will have enough HP left to Shed Tail to a check or counter.

sets.name: Suicide Lead
sets.description:
• Glimmora stands out as one of the best suicide leads in the metagame thanks to its signature ability in Toxic Debris and great utility movepool consisting of Stealth Rock, Spikes, and Memento. Its high Special Attack alongside STAB and coverage options in Power Gem and Earth Power let it threaten most foes including Miraidon, Iron Bundle, and Iron Treads.
  • Tera Ghost Glimmora prevents common spinners like Iron Treads and Great Tusk from removing the entry hazards that Glimmora sets. Glimmora also benefits from Tera Ghost removing its 4x weakness to Ground-type attacks, letting it threaten these spinners with its coverage more reliably. However, given the nature of Glimmora as a dedicated lead, Terastallizing is not generally recommended.
  • Dazzling Gleam threatens Fighting-types like Koraidon and Great Tusk, as well as Miraidon. Its signature move, Mortal Spin, lets Glimmora act as an entry hazard remover and also cripples Stealth Rock setters like Ting-Lu and Great Tusk with poison.
  • Mortal Spin is a good option when facing setup sweepers that Glimmora cannot threaten if it doesn't have the right coverage like Swords Dance + Flame Charge Koraidon, Double Dance Miraidon, and Bulk Up Annihilape.
  • Memento allows a teammate to come in easily while also preventing entry hazard removal attempts.
  • Glimmora likes offensive staples like Miraidon and Koraidon that can take advantage of the entry hazards it sets up. They both threaten to OHKO Defog Corviknight.
  • Glimmora also appreciates Ghost-types such as Annihilape, Flutter Mane, and Gholdengo, while they appreciate the entry hazards that Glimmora sets.

sets.name: Entry Hazard Support (Poison)
sets.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Debris Lead
sets.description:
• With a solid early-game Speed tier, utility, high Special Attack, and decent coverage options, Glimmora can set the tone of a battle, sometimes scoring KOs before fulfilling its main role of setting entry hazards.

  • Mud Shot: This will fail to KO many foes—most notably other Glimmora—but it is a valuable form of speed control that can immediately turn the game in your favor.

  • Mortal Spin: If using Stealth Rock weak teammates like Dragonite or Baxcalibur, clearing the hazards with Mortal Spin can be quite useful.

  • Memento: Memento immediately makes way for a devastating sweeper to set up against foes with halved offensive stats and potentially lowered Speed.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Tera Flying vastly improves Glimmora's matchup against Great Tusk and Garchomp.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type is an option to absorb Spore from Breloom and Brute Bonnet.

Items

  • Focus Sash: This is the most reliable item for setting up Stealth Rock.

  • Air Balloon: With Air Balloon, Glimmora vastly improves its match-up against Ground-type leads such as Garchomp.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description: This set will be up for reservation once the analysis process for Series 2 begins.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description: This is a sample set before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

ru.overview: The tier is still in its infancy and the metagame develops with each passing day. The sample set(s) provided below will be regularly updated until proper analyses are in the works. See it as a rough outline to get started and accustomed to what sets are commonly used.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Scrappy Choice Item
sets.description:
• Scrappy gives Flamigo a unique niche, letting it throw out powerful Close Combats that are unsafe for Gholdengo and Dragapult to take!

  • Throat Chop is a decent filler move, letting Flamigo shut down Sylveon's Hyper Voice and Skeledirge's Torch Song. Note that Close Combat still does more damage to most Ghost-types.

  • Tailwind is a filler move that gives Flamigo's team some extreme speed control before it goes down.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting lets Flamigo fully take advantage of Scrappy, giving Choice Scarf sets a 81.3% chance to OHKO offensive Dragapult.

  • Fire: Tera Fire makes Flamigo immune to Will-O-Wisp, letting Choice Band sets more easily break through Skeledirge, and gives Flamigo the option to 2HKO Corviknight with Tera Blast.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With Choice Scarf, Flamigo outspeeds major threats such as Dragapult and Hydreigon, making it a more effective late-game cleaner.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band lets Flamigo deal massive damage, giving it a shot at 2HKOing Skeledirge with Close Combat.

sets.name: Slush Rush Sweeper
sets.description: This is a sample set before we work on new analyses. These will update as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

sets.name: Wall
sets.description:
Dondozo is one of OU's premier walls, capable of shutting down dangerous setup sweepers like Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon. Liquidation is Dondozo's STAB move of choice due to its lack of recoil, but Wave Crash's power has some merit against foes like Ting-Lu, Skeledirge, and Clodsire. While weaker, Waterfall is another option that has more PP than Liquidation, allowing Dondozo to perform better against stall; however, its use case is rare. Body Press makes use of Dondozo's massive Defense stat and punishes Pokemon like Tera Normal Dragonite and Kingambit. Rest + Sleep Talk provides Dondozo with good sustainability without making it too passive, while Yawn is an option that forces out sweepers Dondozo cannot consistently deal with, like mixed Iron Valiant. On Yawn sets, Leftovers over Heavy-Duty Boots can be beneficial, as Dondozo is vulnerable when it is asleep without Sleep Talk. Grass is the preferred Tera type for eliminating Dondozo's original weaknesses; this is particularly helpful against Meowscarada and Iron Hands. Dragon, however, is an option that keeps Dondozo's resistance to Fire intact, albeit making it weak to Fairy-types like Azumarill and Iron Valiant.

Entry hazard setters like Clodsire and Ting-Lu pair perfectly with Dondozo, playing into its desire to outlast foes long-term with chip damage in the form of entry hazards, status, or Ruination. Both also check special attackers like Iron Valiant and Gholdengo, which Dondozo tends to struggle with. Garganacl deserves a special mention as a teammate due to its ability to wear down foes with Salt Cure; it, in turn, appreciates Dondozo taking on Great Tusk and Kingambit. Hatterene provides Dondozo teams with an excellent sweeper and appreciates Dondozo taking care of physical wallbreakers like Chien-Pao. It also can help by blocking opposing entry hazards with Magic Bounce, letting Dondozo more comfortably tank a Knock Off from Great Tusk or Iron Treads. Similarly, entry hazard removal from Corviknight or Great Tusk is also helpful; Corviknight also deals with Meowscarada, which can force Dondozo to Terastallize early. Gholdengo can help pressure opposing Dondozo while dealing with Espathra and Iron Valiant.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description:
Curse Dondozo is a deceptively strong sweeper that provides good defensive utility before it attempts a sweep. Liquidation is preferred over Wave Crash due to its lack of recoil; however, Wave Crash is an option if a stronger STAB move is desired. Waterfall has higher PP than Liquidation, but it is usually a weaker option. Body Press makes use of Dondozo's naturally high Defense stat and Curse's boosts, while Protect lets Dondozo accumulate Leftovers recovery. However, these two moves can be dropped for the combination of Rest and Sleep Talk, which affords Dondozo greater longevity at the cost of relying on Sleep Talk to call the right move. Leftovers is preferred over Heavy-Duty Boots, as Dondozo will be on the field for many turns in a row to adequately set up with Curse; however, if a team requires it to play more defensively, Heavy-Duty Boots is fine choice. Grass is Dondozo's Tera type of choice, removing its original weaknesses while giving it an important resistance to Ground. Maximum investment in special bulk allows Dondozo to become nigh-unbreakable once it sets up.

Entry hazard removal is key for Dondozo if it does not run Heavy-Duty Boots; good options include Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Corviknight. Though Dondozo can have quite the offensive presence once it sets up, it is best to run it alongside consistent wallbreakers like Dragapult, Gholdengo, and Chien-Pao, which can help break open holes for it to sweep late-game. Similarly, entry hazards from teammates like Garchomp and Glimmora can facilitate Dondozo's sweep. Trick users like Meowscarada and Gholdengo can cripple Dondozo checks like Clodsire and Skeledirge, causing them to lose to Dondozo over the course of the game. While Dondozo is a great sweeper, it is far from consistent at generating setup opportunities; accordingly, it is best to pair it with another bulky sweeper like Iron Defense Garganacl or Hatterene, which can weaken or bait out answers to bulky sweepers like Trick users and Unaware Clodsire.
